entries: The rage and sorrow of a deadwood revenant lives within her as an actual dark flame, which continually consumes her from the inside. Where once she was fair and lovely, now she is cracked and scorched, the heat of the flames within her streaking her once supple flesh with soot. Her fingers crackle and smolder, and she can throw the flames of her sorrow as terrible weapons. The flames inside her are a living curse, infusing her like a terrible heartbeat, and she can levy this curse against any she so chooses, inflicting them with a blight that can never be washed away.

entries.name: Sorrow of the Fey
entries: A deadwood revenant carries with her a palpable atmosphere of bitterness and rage. The flames of her rage have not only burnt away her loveliness but also much of the powers she once wielded. No longer able to step through the trees or speak to the beasts, the deadwood revenant is alone in the world. Not even the other fey will truly accept her back into their fold, her curse making her poor company. As such, these mournful fey wander the world, free from all bonds, indiscriminately wreaking vengeance on the world.

immune.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The otsheentou's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The otsheentou cannot cast spells while it is not inhabiting a plant or in possession of at least one thrall. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The otsheentou is {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The otsheentou can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the otsheentou fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The otsheentou has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Ensnare Thrall
entries: The othsheentou targets one beast, fey, or plant within 15 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or become ensnared by the otsheentou. While ensnared, the creature is {@condition charmed} by the otsheentou and cannot directly disobey an order given by it or voluntarily move more than 1 mile away from it. If the otsheentou can see the thrall, it can make {@i Rend} attacks and cast spells as if it occupied the thrall's space. The thrall is connected to the otsheentou by an {@condition invisible}, incorporeal vine which stretches between the two creatures. This vine can be severed by a successful melee attack made against the vine with a magic weapon or by a creature currently under the effects of {@spell bless} (AC 10). The thrall is released from its ensnarement if the vine is severed, the target is moved more than 1 mile away from the otsheentou, the otsheentou travels to a different plane of existence, or the thrall is subjected to a {@spell dispel evil and good} spell or similar effect.

The thrall must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw at midnight each night. On a failue, the target's maximum hit points are reduced by {@dice 1d10}. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this effect dies.

action.name: Possess Tree (1/Day)
entries: The otsheentou disappears into an intact tree that it can see within 5 feet of it. The tree must be Huge. The otsheentou is now effectively the possessed tree, which it animates and controls. Its type becomes plant, though it retains the demon tag, and it gains 138 temporary hit points. The otsheentou can possess a tree in this way for up to 1 hour.

While possessing the tree, the otsheentou retains its {@i hit points, alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, telepathy, immunity to being charmed and frightened, and Innate Spellcasting features}, as well as its {@i Ensnare Thrall} and {@i Rend} actions. It otherwise uses the statistics of a treant, except without a treant's Animate Trees action.

The possession lasts until the temporary hit points are lost or the otsheentou ends the possession using a bonus action. When the possession ends, the tree reverts to an inanimate tree and otsheentou appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the tree.
If the otsheentou is unable to possess a tree, it has a challenge rating of 9 (5,000 XP).

legendary.name: Rend
entries: The otsheentou makes one Rend attack.

legendary.name: Command Thrall
entries: The otsheentou commands one creature {@condition charmed} by it to use its reaction to move up to its speed in a direction of the otsheentou's choice.

legendary.name: Mirage (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The otsheentou casts {@spell silent image} or {@spell seeming}.

Otsheentou are demons born from the rotting dreams of a dead god of nature. They are hateful, incorporeal demonic spirits that seek to corrupt and destroy nature. Though invisible, if seen with {@i see invisibility} a otsheentou appears to be a massive tangle of spectral bramble vines, each terminating with a vicious mouth. Though powerful, their abilities are limited without a physical host. Therefore, they will possess other creatures.

entries.name: False Groves
entries: A otsheentou is always searching for new victims, preferring to work from a distance while safely ensconced in a dead or dying tree, disguising the blasted grove with magic to look fair and inviting to unsuspecting victims and populating it with charmed fey and beasts. Those that wander into these lovely places become the victims of the otsheentou's sadistic pleasures. The lucky ones are merely ripped apart. The unfortunate ones are possessed, becoming unwilling. vessels for the demon's corruptive power. A otsheentou may even use its grove to start a cult of evil druids

An otsheentou loose in the Material Plane is a terrible blight on the land. It roams through deep forests, ensnaring innocent fey, entangling them in the myriad of spectral vines that extend from their tangled bodies and enslaving them to their will.

entries.name: Possessors
entries: A otsheentou is most effective when acting through ensnare beasts and fey with their spectral tendrils, sinking their hateful thorns into the very souls of their victims. These unfortunate beings become the vessels through which the otsheentou enacts its cruelty upon the natural world. Unable to stop the wretched sins committed around them, these wretched creatures can only watch as the natural world is torn asunder. Creatures possessed by a otsheentou can be identified by the hideous mutations the demon inflicts on them and the invisible vines that extend from the victim, which always lead directly to the otsheentou itself. However the creatures controlled by a otsheentou are readily identifiable by the hideous malformations that the foul demons inflict on their bodies.

entries.name: Disfigured Thralls
entries: The creatures controlled by a otsheentou are readily identifiable by the hideous malformations that the foul demons inflict on their bodies. If you wish, you can use the following malformations to make creatures possessed by an otsheentou readily identifiable.

entries.caption: Thrall Disfigurements
rows: The creature's body sprouts a variety of vines, branches, and vestigial animal limbs.
The creature's flesh becomes swollen with misshapen tumors that drips with blood, pus, and rancid sap.
The creature drools a thick, black slime and oozes it from open sores and damaged limbs.
The foul stench of decay surrounds the creature.
Flies, centipedes, and other foul vermin breed in the creature's flesh, spilling out when the creature takes damage and crawling across its body.
The creature's flesh begins to rot or shrivel. Creatures with fur suffer from mange, while plants discolor and lose leaves.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The wendigo has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The wendigo regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the wendigo takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wendigo's next turn. The wendigo dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wendigo makes two attacks with its claws and one with its bite. If it begins its turn grappling a creature, it can instead make four attacks with its bite.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage. If the wendigo hits a creature with two claw attacks in the same turn, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become infected with {@i Wendigo's Hunger} (see Info section for details). This attack scores a critical hit on a natural roll of 19-20.

bonus.name: Windwalk
entries: The wendigo can begin or stop windwalking. While windwalking, the wendigo is {@condition invisible}, is immune to all non-magical damage, is ephemeral and can't carry anything, can occupy another creature's space, and is {@condition incapacitated}.

A creature being stalked by a windwalking wendigo will occasionally catch glimpses of it in the corner of its eye. While being stalked by a wendigo, a creature has disadvantage on Wisdom checks and saving throws.

The northern tundras are a harsh realm, where only the strong survive and death is a constant companion. In such places, desperation can push a person to do anything to survive. The wendigo is the natural expression of this, a living embodiment of desperation, loneliness, and cannibalism. When a humanoid consumes the flesh of another humanoid, they open themselves up to a foul, demonic hunger which slowly consumes them until they descend into madness, feeding on their kin. Unnaturally fast and bloodthirsty, the lonesome howls of these wind spirits fill the hearts of those who hear them with dread.

entries.name: Spawn of Yeenoghu
entries: Once long ago, Yeenoghu, the demon lord of carnage, escaped the Abyss to roam the winter of the Feywild, where he slayed eladrin by the hundreds. Though he was soon banished, his evil lingered in the cold air. With their winter food stores devoured or fouled, many more eladrin starved. They were the lucky ones. Those that succumbed to their terrible hunger underwent a hideous transformation, infected by the demonic curse left by Yeenoghu, becoming the first wendigos. Now Yeenoghu is served by many of his foul creations, and many more linger still in the world, carrying their hunger through the long night.

entries.name: Wind walkers
entries: A wendigo spends most of its existence in the empty skies of its arctic home, invisible and incorporeal, turning solid only to feed on its victims. The appearance of a wendigo is always horrific, with patchy, matted fur, gnarled antlers, twisted claws for hands, dripping mouths full of uneven teeth, and charred, bloody stumps where their feet should be.

entries.name: Stalk
entries: The wendigo may select a humanoid. It will then follow its target for days or even weeks, dogging their every step. It is unclear why wendigos do this, but it may have something to do with the part of their being that was once mortal yearning for their mortality again. While being stalked by a wendigo, a creature will periodically catch glimpses of the wendigo in their peripheral vision.

The wendigo's presence is unnerving, creating fear and paranoia which persists until the wendigo stops pursuing them. Though unable to speak or communicate, the wendigo is able to fill its victims heads with disturbing images of butchery, desperation, and horrible loneliness. Eventually the wendigo will attack its targets, potentially infecting them with a hideous disease which threatens to turn them into wendigos.

entries.name: Incorporating into Icewind Dale
entries: Wendigos are a well known threat in Icewind Dale, and Reghed shamans have developed rituals to cure their people of Wendigo's Hunger. However, players may become infected by Wendigo's Hunger through bites from wendigos or infected gnolls.

The psychic trauma lingering in the Caves of Hunger prove to be the ideal breeding conditions for lesser wendigo. If you wish, you can alter area H12 so that the curse of hunger imposed by that area is, instead, possession by lesser wendigos.
Tekeli-li naturally recognizes when a creature is infected with Wendigo's Hunger or possessed by a lesser wendigo, and it refrains from attacking such a creature.

entries.name: Wendigo's Hunger
entries: A humanoid that consumes the flesh of another humanoid creature while within the Feywild or an area touched by the Feywild must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or become infected with Wendigo's Hunger, which has an incubation period of {@dice 1d4} days. Once the incubation period is complete, the creature gains the following flaw: “I crave to feed on the flesh of sentient creatures, especially my kin.

The first time each day that an infected creature witnesses a humanoid become injured, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or attempt to feed on them. The infected creature has disadvantage on the saving throw if the humanoid it witnessed being injured is an ally or family member. Each time that a creature infected with the Wendigo's Hunger successfully feeds on another humanoid's flesh, its Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}.

After reach long rest, a creature infected with Wendigo's Hunger must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or have its Wisdom score reduced by 1. When its Wisdom score is reduced to 1, the creature immediately transforms into a wendigo, racing into the sky with such speed that its feet are burned away into charred, bloody stumps.
Gnolls, leucrotta, shoosuva, wendigo, hyenas, and any fiends loyal to Yeenoghu can detect if a creature is infected by Wendigo's Hunger by scent and will avoid attacking it.

Wendigo's Hunger can also be contracted from the bite of a wendigo. If an infected creature does not feed on another sentient creatures for 10 consecutive days, it is cured of Wendigo's Hunger. Otherwise, it can be cured with greater restoration or similar magic. When the creature is cured of Wendigo's Hunger, any reduction in Wisdom that it suffered from the disease is restored.

monster.name: Dustblight
languages: understands Sylvan and Terran but can't speak

trait.name: Cruel Wastes
entries: All creatures within 120 feet of a dustblight have disadvantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks as well as saving throws to resist the effects of extreme heat and dehydration.

trait.name: Crumble
entries: When a dustblight dies, its body crumbles into dust.

trait.name: Eternal Thirst
entries: The dustblight has disadvantage on saving throws to resist spells and effects that drain it of moisture, such as {@spell blight} and {@spell Abi-Dalzim's horrid wilting}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. The dustblight recovers hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

The wastes of the world are cruel and unforgiving. Those who attempt to eke out a living in these inhospitable realms are very well acquainted with the numerous hazards that they present, from the dangers of trying to navigate the shifting dunes to the simple but omnipresent threat of dehydration. These people tell tales of horrible monsters, wretched beings of eternal thirst with flesh like packed ash traced with pulsing rivulets of blood, whose very touch drains the lifeblood from their victims. These are the dustblights, living embodiments of the cruelty of the deserts.

entries.name: Trackless Sands
entries: Dustblights hate all life, and they seek to extinguish it in the cruelest way possible. If a dustblight finds a group of travelers, or better yet a lone wanderer, it will closely follow the poor wretch, leading it away from water and shelter, drawing it deeper into the waste. Dustblights take perverse delight in seeing their victims slowly succumb to despair as their food and water dwindles and their hopes crumble away.

entries.name: Thirst Unquenchable
entries: Once a dustblight has sufficiently exhausted its quarry, it moves in for the kill. The dustblight descends upon the hapless creatures, draining them of their blood to keep its body moist and limber. Should the blood that suffuses its body dry up, a dustblight would crumble into dust.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shiere is an 11th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The shiere has the following ranger spells prepared:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The shiere knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the shiere knight to sleep.

trait.name: Fey Step (Recharges After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the eladrin teleports to an unoccupied space that it can see within 30 feet of it. Immediately after it uses Fey Step, each creature of the eladrin's choice that it can see within 5 feet of it takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shiere makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

The eladrin are the strange elves of the Feywild. Prone to odd flights of fancy and possessed of the same secretive nature as all fey, the eladrin are removed from their cousins in the mortal world. They have few dealings with those who live in the dull realms beyond the Feywild, preferring to remain in their spectacular cities of crystal and living trees, though they may snatch up particularly beautiful men and women and spirit them away.

The shiere knights are the stealthy warriors who serve the tulani lords. Eladrin who have dedicated themselves to the Feywild itself, they form into loose, informal bands, ranging across broad territories to ensure that the delicate balance of nature is preserved, swiftly eliminating any threats to the natural world. In their heart burns the passion of devotion, both to their lords and to their lands.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eladrin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1e: {@spell conjure fey} ({@i does not require concentration})

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eladrin arquen is a 17th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The eladrin has the following warlock spells prepared:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The eladrin arquen has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the eladrin arquen to sleep.

trait.name: Fey Presence
entries: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the eladrin for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target experiences a unique effect related to the eladrin's currently aligned season:

items: {@b Spring.} The target recovers {@dice 1d4} hit points at the beginning of each turn and regains the maximum number of hit points possible from healing.
{@b Summer.} The target is {@condition frightened}.
{@b Autumn.} The target cannot make weapon attacks or cast harmful spells.
{@b Winter.} The target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws.

entries: The {@condition charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the eladrin's Fey Presence for the next 24 hours. Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the {@condition charmed} creature, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The eladrin arquen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The eladrin arquen's weapon attacks are magical, and its longsword possesses the finesse property.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eladrin arquen makes two attacks: either with its longsword or with its longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage with {@spell hex}.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage with {@spell hex}.

bonus.name: Fey Step
entries: The eladrin teleports to an unoccupied space that it can see within 30 feet.

The eladrin are the strange elves of the Feywild. Prone to odd flights of fancy and possessed of the same secretive nature as all fey, the eladrin are removed from their cousins in the mortal world. They have few dealings with those who live in the dull realms beyond the Feywild, preferring to remain in their spectacular cities of crystal and living trees, though they may snatch up particularly beautiful men and women and spirit them away.

The arquen are the representatives of the archfey among the high society of the eladrin. Powerful and inscrutable, they tread the line between mortal and fey. No fey would dare attack the arquen that summoned it, and they willingly serve them both in and out of battle.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The glouras's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12} {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The frost has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Compelling Charm
entries: The first time a beast, monstrosity, aberration, or insane humanoid targets the glouras with an attack or other harmful effect, it must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure the creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the glouras for 24 hours. While {@condition charmed} by the glouras, the two can communicate as if they shared a common language.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The glouras magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the frost wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

Fairies are the little spirits of the Feywild. Of these, the pixies and sprites are the most well known, but many other varieties of fairies exist in the Feywild. It's widely believed that when an infant first laughs, that laugh is born into a new fairy in the Feywild. Whether or not that is true is a hotly debated topic among scholars. Howver, it is clear that even the harsh winter of the fey has its own fairy denizens.

Tiny, mischievous fey of the Underdark, the moth-winged glouras are far rarer than their surface dwelling pixie cousins, and far stranger. Reflecting the strange madness of their dark homes, glouras are prone to odd delusions and fits of giggling. They adore the aberrant wildlife of the Underdark, and will befriend gricks, derro, and chitines as easily as they befriend spiders and giant bats, holding protracted conversations with their coterie of followers.

entries.name: The Dark Maiden
entries: The glouras are often seen as agents of Elistraee, the drow goddess of the moon and rebellion against Lolth's tyranny. As such, drow society as a whole considers glouras to be an abomination, exterminating them whenever possible.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nixie's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12} {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nixie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The nixie can breathe air and water.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The nixie magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the frost wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

Fairies are the little spirits of the Feywild. Of these, the pixies and sprites are the most well known, but many other varieties of fairies exist in the Feywild. It's widely believed that when an infant first laughs, that laugh is born into a new fairy in the Feywild. Whether or not that is true is a hotly debated topic among scholars. Howver, it is clear that even the harsh winter of the fey has its own fairy denizens.

Nixies are the fairies of rivers and ponds. They live beneath lily pads and among the cattail stems, watching visitors to their freshwater homes with wide eyed fascination. They are peaceful, disliking violence, and would much rather play pranks on mortals. They don't always understand that people cannot breathe underwater, though, so they will occasionally drown children that visit them by mistake.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spark's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The spark has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The spark sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet while not {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the spark moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage if doused, or 1 acid damage otherwise.

trait.name: Flame Flit (1/Round)
entries: As long as the spark is fully engulfed in flame, the spark can use a bonus action or a reaction to teleport to any flame in which it can fit within 60 feet. It does not need to be able to see the fire.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The spark magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the frost wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

Fairies are the little spirits of the Feywild. Of these, the pixies and sprites are the most well known, but many other varieties of fairies exist in the Feywild. It's widely believed that when an infant first laughs, that laugh is born into a new fairy in the Feywild. Whether or not that is true is a hotly debated topic among scholars. Howver, it is clear that even the harsh winter of the fey has its own fairy denizens.

The sparks are the cruel fairies of flame. They love to cause mischief and destruction, gleefully spreading fires in both forests and the homes of mortals. When a forest fire occurs, many pixies of the forest will become sparks, burning down their homes with a wild joy that is frightening to see. Other sparks remain sparks indefinitely, serving as saboteurs or spies in hearths and fireplaces.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sylph's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sylph has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Cloudwalker
entries: A sylph can treat any visible vapor as if it is solid, allowing it to walk on clouds and smoke. This requires no concentration and can be done while the sylph sleeps.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The sylph magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the frost wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

Fairies are the little spirits of the Feywild. Of these, the pixies and sprites are the most well known, but many other varieties of fairies exist in the Feywild. It's widely believed that when an infant first laughs, that laugh is born into a new fairy in the Feywild. Whether or not that is true is a hotly debated topic among scholars. Howver, it is clear that even the harsh winter of the fey has its own fairy denizens.

The sylphs are the wind-dancers, joyful spirits of breezes and zephyrs who roam the world in search of new sights and sounds, playing harmless pranks along the way. Though native to the Material Plane, many have found their way into the Plane of Air, where they happily dance through the endless sky.

entries.name: Joyful Wind
entries: A sylph might never touch the ground during its entire life, preferring the freedom of the wind and clouds to the shackles of the earth. Others find life of the creatures on the earth fascinating, playing pranks on those who are bound to the dull earth with innocent glee.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

spellcasting.name: Alvenbloom Bouquet Spellcasting
headerEntries: The petals in a alvenbloom bouquet pool their magic together to increase their spellcasting power. However, that magical power dwindles as their numbers decrease.

The alvenbloom bouquet's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks, or {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks if the alvenbloom bouquet has half its hit points or fewer). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The alvenbloom bouquet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swarm Traits
entries: The alvenbloom bouquet can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the alvenbloom bouquet can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny pixie. The alvenbloom bouquet can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. The alvenbloom bouquet can only be affected by charm or fear effects with an area of effect, like a red dragon's Frightful Presence, and are immune to spells that target a finite number of creatures like {@spell mass suggestion}.

trait.name: Plant Guidance
entries: The alvenbloom bouquet can speak to plants as if they shared a language. Once per day, the alvenbloom bouquet can ask any nearby plants to guide it to a specific location. As long as there are plants in the requested location, the alvenbloom bouquet knows the way to the requested location as if with the {@spell find the path} spell.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The alvenbloom bouquet takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in bright sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The alvenbloom bouquet magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the individual pixies in the alvenbloom bouquet are wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} with them.

bonus.name: Shapechange
entries: The alvenbloom bouquet magically turns into a flock of butterflies or back into its true form. It has the same statistics in both form, but it cannot cast spells while in butterfly form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the alvenbloom bouquet's choice).

Fairies are the little spirits of the Feywild. Of these, the pixies and sprites are the most well known, but many other varieties of fairies exist in the Feywild. It's widely believed that when an infant first laughs, that laugh is born into a new fairy in the Feywild. Whether or not that is true is a hotly debated topic among scholars. Howver, it is clear that even the harsh winter of the fey has its own fairy denizens.

A fairybloom is a group of pixies that have a mutual agreement to work together, whether it be for their own safety, in the service of an Archfey, or simply as a result of friendship. They are like swarms in a number of ways, but they do not have the same mindless quality that swarms display, and every pixie in the fairybloom is an individual, known as a petal in the context of the group. Fairyblooms come in two sizes: bouquets and gardens.

entries.name: Cooperative Magic
entries: Fairyblooms have the advantage of being able to pool their innate magical ability together, granting them far superior spellcasting abilities than they would have on their own. They can use this to better defend themselves against any threats that they may face, but they tend to prefer to use it for fun and pranks.

entries.name: Helpful but Naive
entries: Fairyblooms are rather notorious for their eagerness to help strangers. Should they encounter a group of weary travelers, a fairybloom may take pity on the poor wretches and grant them an enchanted rest, magically putting them to sleep. They remove any uncomfortable armor and weaponry, conscientiously stacking them nearby, and weave blankets and soft clothing out of leaves, moss and petals. However, the fairies do not realize the kind of danger they put their wards in by leaving them defenseless, forgetting that not all forest dwellers are as helpful and kind as them.

entries.name: Attendants to the Fey Lords
entries: It is common for archfey to populate their courts with numerous fairyblooms. These fairyblooms attend to the needs of their lord or lady, whether that be bringing them food, maintaining the cleanliness of their throne room, or providing entertainment. Should their master or mistress's life be threatened, a fairybloom will rise in their defense.

The alven are lighthearted fairies who love nothing more than flowers and fun. They tend to the many species of nightloving flowers in the Shadow Rift. Though they shun from combat, they can entrance those that would harm them with their flitting dances, luring them into traps or off cliffs if threatened.

entries.name: Flower Homes.
entries: Whether in the Shadow Rift or traveling abroad, alven prefer to live in homes woven of grass and branches, surrounded by flowers.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

spellcasting.name: Frostbloom Bouquet Spellcasting
headerEntries: The petals in a frostbloom bouquet pool their magic together to increase their spellcasting power. However, that magical power dwindles as their numbers decrease.

The frostbloom bouquet's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks or {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks if the frostbloom bouquet has half its hit points or fewer). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1e: {@spell sleep} {@i (4th level, or 2th level if the frostbloom bouquet has half its hit points or fewer)}

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The frostbloom bouquet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swarm Traits
entries: The frostbloom bouquet can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the frostbloom bouquet can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny pixie. The frostbloom bouquet can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. The frostbloom bouquet can only be affected by charm or fear effects with an area of effect, like a red dragon's Frightful Presence, and are immune to spells that target a finite number of creatures like {@spell mass suggestion}.

trait.name: Ice Wings
entries: If the frostbloom bouquet takes fire damage, their wings melt and they lose their flying speed until they can make new wings for themselves during a short rest.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The frostbloom bouquet magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the individual pixies in the frostbloom bouquet are wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} with them.

Fairies are the little spirits of the Feywild. Of these, the pixies and sprites are the most well known, but many other varieties of fairies exist in the Feywild. It's widely believed that when an infant first laughs, that laugh is born into a new fairy in the Feywild. Whether or not that is true is a hotly debated topic among scholars. Howver, it is clear that even the harsh winter of the fey has its own fairy denizens.

A fairybloom is a group of pixies that have a mutual agreement to work together, whether it be for their own safety, in the service of an Archfey, or simply as a result of friendship. They are like swarms in a number of ways, but they do not have the same mindless quality that swarms display, and every pixie in the fairybloom is an individual, known as a petal in the context of the group. Fairyblooms come in two sizes: bouquets and gardens.

Should they encounter a group of weary travelers, a fairybloom may take pity on the poor wretches and grant them an enchanted rest, magically putting them to sleep. They remove any uncomfortable armor and weaponry, conscientiously stacking them nearby, and weave blankets and soft clothing out of leaves, moss and petals. However, the fairies do not realize the kind of danger they put their wards in by leaving them defenseless, forgetting that not all forest dwellers are as helpful and kind as them.

entries.name: Attendants to the Fey Lords
entries: It is common for archfey to populate their courts with numerous fairyblooms. These fairyblooms attend to the needs of their lord or lady, whether that be bringing them food, maintaining the cleanliness of their throne room, or providing entertainment. Should their master or mistress's life be threatened, a fairybloom will rise in their defense.

These snow loving fairies are spirits of winter and just as kind and fun loving as their pixie summer-kin, though they are not quite as aware of the needs of warm blooded creatures. They encase delicate leaves in a layer of frost to protect them from the harsh winter cold and frolic with arctic foxes and snow white hares, delighting in the wonders of winter. Though good-natured, these fey will happily serve cruel winter fey, as that is the natural order of fey.

The pixies of temperate climates may become frosts during winter, as if putting on their winter fashion, only to return to being pixies come spring, while those that live in arctic regions will remain as frosts all year round, even if they enter a warmer climate.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

spellcasting.name: Glourasbloom Bouquet Spellcasting
headerEntries: The petals in a glourasbloom bouquet pool their magic together to increase their spellcasting power. However, that magical power dwindles as their numbers decrease.

The glourasbloom bouquet's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks or {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks if the glourasbloom bouquet has half its hit points or fewer). 1e: {@spell sleep} {@i (4th level, or 2nd level if the glourasbloom bouquet has half its hit points or fewer)}

entries.name: Helpful but Naive
entries: Fairyblooms are rather notorious for their eagerness to help strangers. Should they encounter a group of weary travelers, a fairybloom may take pity on the poor wretches and grant them an enchanted rest, magically putting them to sleep. They remove any uncomfortable armor and weaponry, conscientiously stacking them nearby, and weave blankets and soft clothing out of leaves, moss and petals. However, the fairies do not realize the kind of danger they put their wards in by leaving them defenseless, forgetting that not all forest dwellers are as helpful and kind as them.

entries.name: Attendants to the Fey Lords
entries: It is common for archfey to populate their courts with numerous fairyblooms. These fairyblooms attend to the needs of their lord or lady, whether that be bringing them food, maintaining the cleanliness of their throne room, or providing entertainment. Should their master or mistress's life be threatened, a fairybloom will rise in their defense.

Nixies are the fairies of rivers and ponds. They live beneath lily pads and among the cattail stems, watching visitors to their freshwater homes with wide eyed fascination. They are peaceful, disliking violence, and would much rather play pranks on mortals. They don't always understand that people cannot breathe underwater, though, so they will occasionally drown children that visit them by mistake.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

spellcasting.name: Sparkbloom Bouquet Spellcasting
headerEntries: The petals in a sparkbloom bouquet pool their magic together to increase their spellcasting power. However, that magical power dwindles as their numbers decrease.

The sparkbloom bouquet's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks or {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks if the sparkbloom bouquet has half its hit points or fewer). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1e: {@spell sleep} {@i (4th level, or 2nd level if the sparkbloom bouquet has half its hit points or fewer)}

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sparkbloom bouquet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swarm Traits
entries: The sparkbloom bouquet can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the sparkbloom bouquet can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny pixie. The sparkbloom bouquet can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. The sparkbloom bouquet can only be affected by charm or fear effects with an area of effect, like a red dragon's Frightful Presence, and are immune to spells that target a finite number of creatures like {@spell mass suggestion}.

trait.name: Flame Flit (1/Round)
entries: As long as the sparkbloom bouquet is fully engulfed in flame, the sparkbloom bouquet can use a bonus action or a reaction to teleport to any flame in which it can fit within 60 feet. It does not need to be able to see the fire.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The sparkbloom bouquet sheds bright light in a 30- foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 ft. while not {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 ft. the sparkbloom bouquet moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The sparkbloom bouquet magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the individual pixies in the sparkbloom bouquet are wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} with them.

Fairies are the little spirits of the Feywild. Of these, the pixies and sprites are the most well known, but many other varieties of fairies exist in the Feywild. It's widely believed that when an infant first laughs, that laugh is born into a new fairy in the Feywild. Whether or not that is true is a hotly debated topic among scholars. Howver, it is clear that even the harsh winter of the fey has its own fairy denizens.

A fairybloom is a group of pixies that have a mutual agreement to work together, whether it be for their own safety, in the service of an Archfey, or simply as a result of friendship. They are like swarms in a number of ways, but they do not have the same mindless quality that swarms display, and every pixie in the fairybloom is an individual, known as a petal in the context of the group. Fairyblooms come in two sizes: bouquets and gardens.

entries.name: Cooperative Magic
entries: Fairyblooms have the advantage of being able to pool their innate magical ability together, granting them far superior spellcasting abilities than they would have on their own. They can use this to better defend themselves against any threats that they may face, but they tend to prefer to use it for fun and pranks.

entries.name: Helpful but Naive

Should they encounter a group of weary travelers, a fairybloom may take pity on the poor wretches and grant them an enchanted rest, magically putting them to sleep. They remove any uncomfortable armor and weaponry, conscientiously stacking them nearby, and weave blankets and soft clothing out of leaves, moss and petals. entries.name: Attendants to the Fey Lords
entries: It is common for archfey to populate their courts with numerous fairyblooms. These fairyblooms attend to the needs of their lord or lady, whether that be bringing them food, maintaining the cleanliness of their throne room, or providing entertainment. Should their master or mistress's life be threatened, a fairybloom will rise in their defense.

The sparks are the cruel fairies of flame. They love to cause mischief and destruction, gleefully spreading fires in both forests and the homes of mortals. When a forest fire occurs, many pixies of the forest will become sparks, burning down their homes with a wild joy that is frightening to see. Other sparks remain sparks indefinitely, serving as saboteurs or spies in hearths and fireplaces.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

trait.name: Cloudwalker
entries: The sylphbloom bouquet can treat any visible vapor as if it is solid, allowing it to walk on clouds and smoke. This requires no concentration and can be done while the sylphbloom bouquet sleeps.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The sylphbloom bouquet magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the individual pixies in the sylphbloom bouquet are wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} with them.

Should their master or mistress's life be threatened, a fairybloom will rise in their defense.

The sylphs are the wind-dancers, joyful spirits of breezes and zephyrs who roam the world in search of new sights and sounds, playing harmless pranks along the way. Though native to the Material Plane, many have found their way into the Plane of Air, where they happily dance through the endless sky.

entries.name: Joyful Wind
entries: A sylph might never touch the ground during its entire life, preferring the freedom of the wind and clouds to the shackles of the earth. Others find life of the creatures on the earth fascinating, playing pranks on those who are bound to the dull earth with innocent glee.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

spellcasting.name: Alvenbloom Garden Spellcasting
headerEntries: The petals in a alvenbloom garden pool their magic together to increase their spellcasting power. However, that magical power dwindles as their numbers decrease.

The alvenbloom garden's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks or {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks if the alvenbloom garden has half its hit points or fewer). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The alvenbloom garden has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swarm Traits
entries: The alvenbloom garden can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the alvenbloom garden can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny pixie. The alvenbloom garden can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. The alvenbloom garden can only be affected by charm or fear effects with an area of effect, like a red dragon's Frightful Presence, and are immune to spells that target a finite number of creatures like {@spell mass suggestion}.

trait.name: Plant Guidance
entries: The alvenbloom garden can speak to plants as if they shared a language. Once per day, the alvenbloom garden can ask any nearby plants to guide it to a specific location. As long as there are plants in the requested location, the alvenbloom garden knows the way to the requested location as if with the {@spell find the path} spell.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The alvenbloom garden takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in bright sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The alvenbloom garden magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the individual pixies in the alvenbloom garden are wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} with them.

bonus.name: Shapechange
entries: The alvenbloom garden magically turns into a flock of butterflies or back into its true form. It has the same statistics in both form, but it cannot cast spells while in butterfly form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the alvenbloom garden's choice).

The alven are lighthearted fairies who love nothing more than flowers and fun. They tend to the many species of nightloving flowers in the Shadow Rift. Though they shun from combat, they can entrance those that would harm them with their flitting dances, luring them into traps or off cliffs if threatened.

entries.name: Flower Homes.
entries: Whether in the Shadow Rift or traveling abroad, alven prefer to live in homes woven of grass and branches, surrounded by flowers.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

trait.name: Ice Wings
entries: If the frostbloom garden takes fire damage, their wings melt and they lose their flying speed until they can make new wings for themselves during a short rest.

Should their master or mistress's life be threatened, a fairybloom will rise in their defense.

These snow loving fairies are spirits of winter and just as kind and fun loving as their pixie summer-kin, though they are not quite as aware of the needs of warm blooded creatures. They encase delicate leaves in a layer of frost to protect them from the harsh winter cold and frolic with arctic foxes and snow white hares, delighting in the wonders of winter. Though good-natured, these fey will happily serve cruel winter fey, as that is the natural order of fey.

The pixies of temperate climates may become frosts during winter, as if putting on their winter fashion, only to return to being pixies come spring, while those that live in arctic regions will remain as frosts all year round, even if they enter a warmer climate.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

Tiny, mischievous fey of the Underdark, the moth-winged glouras are far rarer than their surface dwelling pixie cousins, and far stranger. Reflecting the strange madness of their dark homes, glouras are prone to odd delusions and fits of giggling. They adore the aberrant wildlife of the Underdark, and will befriend gricks, derro, and chitines as easily as they befriend spiders and giant bats, holding protracted conversations with their coterie of followers.

entries.name: The Dark Maiden
entries: The glouras are often seen as agents of Elistraee, the drow goddess of the moon and rebellion against Lolth's tyranny. As such, drow society as a whole considers glouras to be an abomination, exterminating them whenever possible.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

entries.name: Helpful but Naive
entries: Fairyblooms are rather notorious for their eagerness to help strangers. Should they encounter a group of weary travelers, a fairybloom may take pity on the poor wretches and grant them an enchanted rest, magically putting them to sleep. They remove any uncomfortable armor and weaponry, conscientiously stacking them nearby, and weave blankets and soft clothing out of leaves, moss and petals. However, the fairies do not realize the kind of danger they put their wards in by leaving them defenseless, forgetting that not all forest dwellers are as helpful and kind as them.

entries.name: Attendants to the Fey Lords
entries: It is common for archfey to populate their courts with numerous fairyblooms. These fairyblooms attend to the needs of their lord or lady, whether that be bringing them food, maintaining the cleanliness of their throne room, or providing entertainment. Should their master or mistress's life be threatened, a fairybloom will rise in their defense.

The sparks are the cruel fairies of flame. They love to cause mischief and destruction, gleefully spreading fires in both forests and the homes of mortals. When a forest fire occurs, many pixies of the forest will become sparks, burning down their homes with a wild joy that is frightening to see. Other sparks remain sparks indefinitely, serving as saboteurs or spies in hearths and fireplaces.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

spellcasting.name: Sylphbloom Garden Spellcasting
headerEntries: The petals in a sylphbloom garden pool their magic together to increase their spellcasting power. However, that magical power dwindles as their numbers decrease.

The sylphbloom garden's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks or {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks if the sylphbloom garden has half its hit points or fewer). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sylphbloom garden has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swarm Traits
entries: The sylphbloom garden can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the sylphbloom garden can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny pixie. The sylphbloom garden can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. The sylphbloom garden can only be affected by charm or fear effects with an area of effect, like a red dragon's Frightful Presence, and are immune to spells that target a finite number of creatures like {@spell mass suggestion}.

trait.name: Cloudwalker
entries: The sylphbloom garden can treat any visible vapor as if it is solid, allowing it to walk on clouds and smoke. This requires no concentration and can be done while the sylphbloom bouquet sleeps.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The sylphbloom garden magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the individual pixies in the sylphbloom garden are wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} with them.

Fairies are the little spirits of the Feywild. Of these, the pixies and sprites are the most well known, but many other varieties of fairies exist in the Feywild. It's widely believed that when an infant first laughs, that laugh is born into a new fairy in the Feywild. Whether or not that is true is a hotly debated topic among scholars. Howver, it is clear that even the harsh winter of the fey has its own fairy denizens.

A fairybloom is a group of pixies that have a mutual agreement to work together, whether it be for their own safety, in the service of an Archfey, or simply as a result of friendship. They are like swarms in a number of ways, but they do not have the same mindless quality that swarms display, and every pixie in the fairybloom is an individual, known as a petal in the context of the group. Fairyblooms come in two sizes: bouquets and gardens.

entries.name: Cooperative Magic
entries: Fairyblooms have the advantage of being able to pool their innate magical ability together, granting them far superior spellcasting abilities than they would have on their own. They can use this to better defend themselves against any threats that they may face, but they tend to prefer to use it for fun and pranks.

entries.name: Helpful but Naive
entries: Fairyblooms are rather notorious for their eagerness to help strangers. Should they encounter a group of weary travelers, a fairybloom may take pity on the poor wretches and grant them an enchanted rest, magically putting them to sleep. They remove any uncomfortable armor and weaponry, conscientiously stacking them nearby, and weave blankets and soft clothing out of leaves, moss and petals. However, the fairies do not realize the kind of danger they put their wards in by leaving them defenseless, forgetting that not all forest dwellers are as helpful and kind as them.

entries.name: Attendants to the Fey Lords
entries: It is common for archfey to populate their courts with numerous fairyblooms. These fairyblooms attend to the needs of their lord or lady, whether that be bringing them food, maintaining the cleanliness of their throne room, or providing entertainment. Should their master or mistress's life be threatened, a fairybloom will rise in their defense.

The sylphs are the wind-dancers, joyful spirits of breezes and zephyrs who roam the world in search of new sights and sounds, playing harmless pranks along the way. Though native to the Material Plane, many have found their way into the Plane of Air, where they happily dance through the endless sky.

entries.name: Joyful Wind
entries: A sylph might never touch the ground during its entire life, preferring the freedom of the wind and clouds to the shackles of the earth. Others find life of the creatures on the earth fascinating, playing pranks on those who are bound to the dull earth with innocent glee.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 10th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Bardic Inspiration (4/Day)
entries: The bard can inspire others through stirring words or music. As a bonus action on the bard's turn, they can choose one creature other than themselves within 60 feet of them who can hear them. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration die, which is a {@dice d10}.

bonus.name: Mantle of Inspiration (2/Day)
entries: The bard takes on a magnificent appearance. Up to three creatures within 60 feet of the bard that it can see gain 11 temporary hit points and can use their reaction to move up to their speed without provoking an opportunity attack.

bonus.name: Mantle of Majesty (1/Day)
entries: The bard casts {@spell Command}, without expending a spell slot, and can take on an appearance of unearthly beauty for 1 minute or until the bard's concentration ends as if they were concentrating on a spell. During this time, the bard can cast {@spell Command} as a bonus action on each of their turns, without expending a spell slot. Any creature {@condition charmed} by the bard automatically fails its saving throw against the {@spell Command} the bard cast with this feature.
Many mortals have found ways to touch the realm of the fey. Others have been touched by the fey, will they or won't they. A mortal is never the same once touched by the influence of the Feywild.

These bards were tutored by satyrs, eladrin, and even banshrae or firre, learning the spectacular magic of fey glamour. Able to inspire emotions through their music and to create cunning illusions and wild fancies, these bards are loved and feared in equal measure.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 10th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The druid has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Hidden Paths (4/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the druid can teleport themselves up to 60 feet or use an action to teleport a willing creature they can touch up to 30 feet into an unoccupied space they can see.

trait.name: Balm of the Summer Court (10/Day)
entries: The druid have a pool of fey energy represented by a number of {@dice d6}s that equals their level. As a bonus action, the druid can choose an ally they can see within 120 feet of them and spend up to half of those dice each time. The target regains a number of hit points equal to the total. The target also gains 1 temporary hit point per die spent.

trait.name: Wild Shape (4/Day)
entries: The druid can use their action to magically assume the shape of a beast. The druid can stay in a beast shape for a number of hours equal to half their druid level. The druid's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but they retain their alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. Also, the druid also retain all of their skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. When the druid transform, they assume the beast’s hit points and hit dice. When they revert to their normal form, they return to the number of hit points they had before they transformed. However, if they revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to their normal form. While in a beast's shape, the druid can’t cast spells, and their ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of their beast form. Transforming doesn’t break their concentration on a spell they’ve already cast, however, or prevent them from taking actions that are part of a spell that they’ve already cast.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.
Many mortals have found ways to touch the realm of the fey. Others have been touched by the fey, will they or won't they. A mortal is never the same once touched by the influence of the Feywild.

Druids of the circle of dreams hail from lands touched by the Feywild. They have learned to channel the strange, dreamlike magic of the Feywild that can be found all throughout nature, striving to fill the world with the surreal wonder and peace of the Feywild.

trait.name: Action Surge (1/Day)
entries: On their turn, the archer can take one additional action.

trait.name: Arcane Shot (1/Turn)
entries: When the archer hits a target with a longbow attack, the archer can apply one of the following options. Each option can only be used once per day:

items: {@b Banishing Arrow.} The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or be banished to a harmless dream realm until the end of the target's next turn.

{@b Beguiling Arrow.} The target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by one ally of the archer within 30 feet of the target until the start of the archer's next turn. The effect ends early if the chosen ally attacks the {@condition charmed} target or forces it to make a saving throw.

{@b Grasping Arrow.} The target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and becomes entangled with grasping, poisonous brambles for 1 minute. While entangled, the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage whenever it moves more than 1 foot without teleporting. The target or any creature within 5 feet of it can use an action to remove the vines with a successful {@dc 14} Strength (Athletics) check.

trait.name: Curving Shot
entries: When the archer makes an attack roll with a magic arrow and miss, they can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

trait.name: Magic Arrows
entries: The archer's arrows are magical until immediately after they hit or miss a target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The archer makes two longbow attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold, fire, or lightning damage (the archer's choice).
Many mortals have found ways to touch the realm of the fey. Others have been touched by the fey, will they or won't they. A mortal is never the same once touched by the influence of the Feywild.
The elves of the Feywild have learned to imbue their arrows with arcane energy, and the secrets of arcane archery have since expanded beyond the Feywild.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The green knight is an 11th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: Whenever the paladin or a friendly creature to them within 10 feet of them must make a saving throw, the creature gains a bonus to the saving throw equal to the paladin's Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Divine Smite (1/Turn)
entries: When the paladin hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, they can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon’s damage. The extra damage is {@dice 2d8} for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@dice 1d8} for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of {@dice 5d8}.

trait.name: Improved Divine Smite
entries: Whenever the paladin hits a creature with a melee weapon, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The green knight makes three attacks: either with its maul or with its longsword.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with both hands plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.
Many mortals have found ways to touch the realm of the fey. Others have been touched by the fey, will they or won't they. A mortal is never the same once touched by the influence of the Feywild.

Green knights are paladins who took the oath of the ancients, devoting their lives to ensuring that light and joy always remain in the world. They spend their time spreading merriment by easing the burdens of the suffering, working hard to ensure that hope lives on even in the most dark of times. These paladins frequently worship gods of peaceful nature such as Chauntea, Mielikki, and Eldath, and will sometimes even swear oaths of fealty to powerful archfey such as Titania, Morwel, and Hyrsam, swearing to serve their interests by spreading light and good cheer through the mortal realm.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 12th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The druid has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Powerful Summons
entries: When the druid summons a fey creature with a spell slot, the fey is summoned with maximum hit points.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: The druid can communicate with beasts as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Wild Shape (3/Day)
entries: The druid can use their action to magically assume the shape of a beast. The druid can stay in a beast shape for a number of hours equal to half their druid level. The druid's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but they retain their alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. Also, the druid also retain all of their skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. When the druid transform, they assume the beast’s hit points and hit dice. When they revert to their normal form, they return to the number of hit points they had before they transformed. However, if they revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to their normal form. While in a beast's shape, the druid can’t cast spells, and their ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of their beast form. Transforming doesn’t break their concentration on a spell they’ve already cast, however, or prevent them from taking actions that are part of a spell that they’ve already cast.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit ({@hit 7} to hit with {@spell shillelagh}), reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage or {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage with {@spell shillelagh}.
Many mortals have found ways to touch the realm of the fey. Others have been touched by the fey, will they or won't they. A mortal is never the same once touched by the influence of the Feywild.

Druids of the circle of shepherds are inherently kind people. They feel responsibility for all living things, especially those which cannot defend themselves. They shoulder the burden of defending the natural world, stopping over-hunting and the destruction of the land.

entries.name: Fey Speakers
entries: The shepherds are defenders of the fey, and by extension they are intermediaries between the fey and mortals. They have little interest in the petty politics of the fey courts, however, preferring to commune with treants and spirits of the land.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The merfolk is an 11th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks) and can use its own voice as a spellcasting focus. The merfolk has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merfolk can breathe both air and water.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

Merfolk sirens are the cause of tales of ships run aground on jagged rocks and sailors flinging themselves from ships into the briny deep. Well versed in the strange magic of songs, merfolk sirens are closer to the creatures of the Feywild, and their motivations are often strange and hard to understand. These merfolk become leaders of cultish followings of other merfolk, befriending like minded nereids. Some even wind up becoming lovers or servants of huriat and other powerful ocean fey.

swim.condition: (5 ft, swim 60 ft. in seal form)

trait.name: Selkie Pelt
entries: The selkie is born with a magic pelt. So long as it has the pelt on its person, it possesses the shapechanger tag and can use a bonus action to transform into a seal or into its human form. When in seal form its statistics are the same except its movement changes as noted above.

If its pelt is taken from it, the selkie automatically gains the statistics of a Commoner but retains its Charisma, hit points. and languages, though it cannot speak. A selkie cannot outright disobey an order given to it by whoever holds its pelt, but it can choose to be creative about how they interpret the orders. If the pelt is destroyed, the selkie sickens and dies within an hour.

trait.name: Speak with Aquatic Beasts
entries: The selkie can communicate with beasts that possess an innate swimming speed as if they shared a language.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

Selkies are the elusive folk, those with beautiful voices and fair faces who disguise themselves as seals to escape detection. The selkies know the ocean's secret songs, and they sing them from quiet beaches and atop lonely reefs.

entries.name: Bound by Matrimony
entries: The selkies appear as beautiful men and women, and those who see them cannot help but fall in love with the deep depths they see in their eyes. This is where the cruelest fate can befall the elusive folk, for if their pelt is taken from them, they are bound to the will of whosoever holds it. These unfortunate folk are often forced into marriage with their captors, their hearts silently yearning for the ocean that is denied to them. If the selkie ever recovers its pelt, it will abandon everything, even its own children, to return to its true home.

monster.name: Forlarren
languages: Sylvan and either Abyssal or Infernal

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The forlarren's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Moral Ambivalence
entries: On dawn of each day, roll {@dice 1d4}. On an even roll, the forlarren is neutral good. On an odd roll, the forlarren is neutral evil.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The forlarren has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

Nymphs are physical embodiments of the beauty of nature whose lives are bound either to a location such as a tree or a mountain, an object such as a mantle or a veil, or a natural phenomenon such as a flame or a cloud. Whether male or female, a nymph is always heartbreakingly lovely and incredibly perilous.

entries.name: Forlarren
entries: A forlarren is the result of a demon, devil, or other fiend impregnating a nymph. The resulting child is torn between the innate goodness of gentle nature and the cruelty and wickedness of the Lower Planes. Their souls are wildly unstable and fluctuate between good and evil at random. As such, they find little welcome in the fey society of their mothers, while they cannot stomach the wanton evil of their father's realm.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The fossergrim can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fossergrim has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: As long as it remains within an area of clean water, the fossergrim regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. The fossergrim dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: True Strike
entries: The fossergrim has advantage on all attack rolls against targets in its native waters.

trait.name: Turbulent Stride
entries: A fossergrim ignores difficult terrain created by fast moving waters, such as rapids or waterfalls. It automatically succeeds on Strength and Dexterity saving throws to avoid being pushed, pulled, or knocked {@condition prone} by water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fossergrim makes two attacks with one of its weapons.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Fiddle
entries: The fossergrim begins to play a compelling tune on its fiddle. All creatures within 60 of it that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the fossergrim. While {@condition charmed}, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and attempts to follow the fossergrim. The creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns and whenever its compelled path would lead it into an obvious hazard, ending the effect on a success. The effect ends automatically if the fossergrim stops playing or the creature takes damage. Otherwise, the effect persists for as long as the fossergrim continues playing the fiddle, which it can continue doing on subsequent turns as if concentrating on a spell, though it can take no other actions or reactions while concentrating. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the fossergrim's Fiddle for the next 24 hours.

In a village in the wilderness, young men and women are warned to flee from the sounds of music coming from the waterfall. Those that follow the beautiful melodies disappear forever into the deep, rushing waters of the river, never to be seen again. They say that a fossergrim guards the waterfall, and his songs enchant the mind and enslave the body. The elders of the village honor him with offerings of jewelry and fine clothing, and in return he guards their waters.

entries.name: Men of the Waterfalls
entries: Fossergrim appear as ruggedly handsome men dressed in shining chain mail and fine clothing, strong of back and well-armed. They are bound to a single waterfall, making their homes in cozy caves dug out behind them and aggressively defending their homes from anyone that would pollute or dam the source river, swimming upstream like a fish to deal with any trouble. They usually pay little mind to those who drink or bathe in their waters, but their attentions may be attracted by an exceptionally attractive visitor. The music of their fiddles compels those who hear it to follow, and the fossergrim take what they want.

trait.name: Cold Curse
entries: Whenever a gelun takes cold damage and does not have temporary hit points from its Slam attack or Heat Sink trait, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + the damage dealt or have its speed reduced by a cumulative 5 feet for 1 minute. Taking fire damage negates this effect. If the gelun's speed is reduced to 0, it becomes {@condition restrained} and {@condition incapacitated} until the ice melts, the rate at which depends on the ambient temperature. The gelun has advantage on the saving throw if the ambient temperature is extremely hot.

trait.name: Frigid Aura
entries: A creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the gelun takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

trait.name: Heat Sink
entries: When a gelun would take fire damage, it instead takes no damage and gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the fire damage it would have taken. These temporary hit points last until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage and the gelun gains temporary hit points equal to the amount of cold damage dealt.

When one thinks of a desert, one imagines the hot sun glaring down on baking sand and clay. However, there is another side to the deserts, the night side. When the sun goes down, the temperature drops dramatically. Where once you may have been sweltering, now you find your teeth chattering and your breath rushing from your mouth like fog. This is the life of the gelun, those with skin like translucent ice and fingers forever crusted in frost, cursed to endure cold for offenses committed an epoch ago.

entries.name: Cursed Cold Ones
