entries: An elder dusk hag that has attained the status of grandmother or auntie may have a handful of lair actions available to it. Consult {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters} pg. 59 for more detail on hag lair actions. Those actions happen on Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties).

items: All creatures within the lair that the elder dusk hag can see must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be subjected to the effects of the {@spell compulsion} spell until initiative count 20 of the following round.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful elder dusk hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Rolling banks of fog are common in the area. Visions of lost loved ones or hated enemies can be glimpsed in the fog, and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made to avoid becoming lost have disadvantage. The resident dusk hag has no difficulty navigating this fog.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The fanggen hag takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in bright sunlight. While in sunlight, she has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Tree Bound
entries: If the fanggen hag travels more than 100 feet away from her tree or her tree dies she becomes {@condition poisoned} and takes {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage every hour until she returns to her living tree.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on her turn, the fanggen hag can use 10 feet of movement to step magically into one living tree within reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. If this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0, the target dies and its body crumbles away, save for its skull which becomes crystal and traps its soul within.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The fanggen hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the fanggen hag makes an attack, takes a bonus action to end it, or if she dies.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the fanggen hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the fanggen hag is disguised.

A fanggen hag is a nasty, twisted old crone with skin like gnarled tree bark that is bound to a single tree, which it decorates with the crystallized skulls of its victims. No mortal truly knows where a fanggen hag comes from. Some believe that they are dryads who became twisted by bitterness, perhaps becoming corrupted by the influence of demonic or undead spirits. Others state that they are hags who offended a powerful fey lord and were irrevocably bound to a single tree as punishment. All that is known for certain is that they are wretched and dangerous creatures.

entries.name: Life Eaters
entries: A fanggen hag is capable of draining the life from an unsuspecting victim, causing the flesh to wither off the bone and the skeleton to crumble until only the skull is left, miraculously transformed into a beautiful crystal material. This is the true horror of the fanggen hag, as the spirits of those whom they kill in this way are bound to these crystalline skulls for as long as the skulls endure, forced to entertain the hag and even serve her in death.

entries.name: Secret Keepers
entries: A fanggen hag is indivisible from its tree and cannot venture far from it without sickening and dying. However, the hags have an insatiable appetite for secrets. They crave every variety of secrets, from the intimate secrets of common peasants to the kingdom shaking secrets of royalty. They record secrets they obtain in the knots on their trees and eagerly trade magical favors for secrets, though they are loathe to give up one of their own secrets. However, a fanggen hag is treacherous and will just as soon kill a creature than barter with it, as she can simply demand all the secrets she wants from the victim’s crystalized skull. Only the promise of more secrets can stave off the hag’s vicious nature.

entries.name: Metamorphosis
entries: Once a fanggen hag has consumed enough victims, it can undergo a stunning metamorphosis. It encases the trunk of its tree in luminous amber and falls into a deep slumber, which can last for months or even years. During this time, the spirits of its past victims lurk forever nearby, protecting their mistress from harm. Once the transformation is complete, the amber falls away from the tree to reveal the beautiful figure of a brauchen, a fey spirit so lovely that those that try to harm it fall under its sway.

A brauchen is like a fanggen hag in many ways. Though cleansed of their wickedness, they are still bound to their trees and yearn for gossip from beyond the boundaries of their forests. A brauchen is also able to drain the life from its victims, transforming them into spirits bound to crystalline skulls just as fanggen hags do. Not all fanggen hags choose to undergo this metamorphosis, though.

entries.name: A Fanggen Hag's Lair
entries: A fanggen hag’s lair consists of the grove that contains its tree. This grove is always overgrown, preventing most sunlight from reaching the ground. However, the hag is likely to disguise it with illusions to make it appear inviting. Some fanggen hags may choose to construct rude huts around their trees, while others may prefer to leave the wilderness untamed, encouraging the growth of twisted plantlife and breeding swarms of stinging insects.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: A fanggen hag that has attained the status of grandmother or auntie may have a handful of lair actions available to it. Consult {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters} pg. 59 for more detail on hag lair actions. Those actions happen on Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties).

items: Grasping roots and vines erupt in a 20 foot radius sphere from a point on the ground that the hag can see within 120 feet of him. The area becomes difficult terrain, and each creature in the area when it first appears must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained}. A creature can be freed if it or another creature takes an action to make a {@dc 12} Strength check and succeeds. The roots and vines wilt away if the hag uses this action again or he dies. The area counts as a suitably sized tree for the purposes of the hag’s Tree Stride feature (but not for the Tree Sanctuary legendary action).

The hag targets one creature it can see within 30 ft. of it. The target must contest its Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check against the hag’s Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If the hag wins, it magically learns one secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful fanggen hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Illusions that function similarly to {@spell hallucinatory terrain} may generate spontaneously or at the direction of the hag in order to disguise dangerous or frightening features as welcoming and safe.
The crystal skulls of the hag’s past victims may be found throughout the area. The hag immediately knows if one of these skulls is handled, and can communicate telepathically with the handler.

legendary.name: Curse (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elder fanggen hag casts {@spell bestow curse} ({@dc 15}).

legendary.name: Tree Sanctuary (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elder fanggen hag magically steps into one Large or larger tree within 5 feet of her. While within the tree, the elder fanggen hag is {@condition incapacitated} but has total cover. The elder fanggen hag must use at least 5 feet of movement by the end of her next turn to exit from this tree or another Large or larger tree within 60 feet.

During this time, the spirits of its past victims lurk forever nearby, protecting their mistress from harm. Once the transformation is complete, the amber falls away from the tree to reveal the beautiful figure of a brauchen, a fey spirit so lovely that those that try to harm it fall under its sway.

A brauchen is like a fanggen hag in many ways. Though cleansed of their wickedness, they are still bound to their trees and yearn for gossip from beyond the boundaries of their forests. A brauchen is also able to drain the life from its victims, transforming them into spirits bound to crystalline skulls just as fanggen hags do. Not all fanggen hags choose to undergo this metamorphosis, though.

entries.name: Covens
entries: An elder fanggen hag that is part of a coven (see the “Hag Covens” sidebar in the {@i Monster Manual}) has a challenge rating of 10 (5,900XP).

entries.name: A Fanggen Hag's Lair
entries: A fanggen hag’s lair consists of the grove that contains its tree. This grove is always overgrown, preventing most sunlight from reaching the ground. However, the hag is likely to disguise it with illusions to make it appear inviting. Some fanggen hags may choose to construct rude huts around their trees, while others may prefer to leave the wilderness untamed, encouraging the growth of twisted plantlife and breeding swarms of stinging insects.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: A fanggen hag that has attained the status of grandmother or auntie may have a handful of lair actions available to it. Consult {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters} pg. 59 for more detail on hag lair actions. Those actions happen on Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties).

items: Grasping roots and vines erupt in a 20 foot radius sphere from a point on the ground that the hag can see within 120 feet of him. The area becomes difficult terrain, and each creature in the area when it first appears must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained}. A creature can be freed if it or another creature takes an action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check and succeeds. The roots and vines wilt away if the hag uses this action again or he dies. The area counts as a suitably sized tree for the purposes of the hag’s Tree Stride feature (but not for the Tree Sanctuary legendary action).

The hag targets one creature it can see within 30 ft. of it. The target must contest its Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check against the hag’s Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If the hag wins, it magically learns one secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful fanggen hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Illusions that function similarly to {@spell hallucinatory terrain} may generate spontaneously or at the direction of the hag in order to disguise dangerous or frightening features as welcoming and safe.
The crystal skulls of the hag’s past victims may be found throughout the area. The hag immediately knows if one of these skulls is handled, and can communicate telepathically with the handler.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hocus hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Enchanting Song
entries: The hocus hag begins singing a magical melody. The song can only affect humanoids and giants of a specific level of maturity, which the hocus hag decides when she begins singing. Those levels are children, teenagers, adults, or eldery. Every humanoid and giant of the selected level of maturity within 300 ft. of the hocus hag that can hear the song must succeed on a {dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. The hocus hag must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. The hocus hag can provide verbal components for spells and maintain concentration on spells while singing this song. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the hocus hag is {@condition incapacitated}.

While {@condition charmed} by the hocus hag in this way, a target is affected as if by the {@spell suggestion} spell, the command for which need not be included in the song. The effect ends on a creature if the hocus hag or her allies does anything to harm the creature or if the creature is exposed to sunlight. If a creature remains {@condition charmed} in this way for 3 uninterrupted minutes, the suggestion effect of the song persists for 8 more hours until otherwise ended.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this hocus hag's song for the next 24 hours.

bonus.name: Empower Cleaning Implement
entries: The hocus hag can enchant any cleaning implement that she can easily lift to behave as a {@item broom of flying} for as long as she remains in contact with it.

The hocus hags are strange among their kind, as they are obsessed with attaining the adoration of others. In their true forms, they have dull grey skin and barely more than a few strands of thin, stringy hair on their heads. However, this is rearely seen, as they use every tool at their disposal to make themselves seem as appealing as possible. Elaborate makeup, expensive dresses, illusory charms, magical enchantments, transformative potions, nothing is of limits in their goal to secure the love and adoration of every creature they meet.

entries.name: You're Going to Love Me
entries: A hocus hag needs to be loved by every creature she encounters. She will not be satisfied until she has secured the unending devotion of every creature in the world. They take a wide range of approaches towards achieving this. Some will become divas, performing spectacularly dramatic arias or telling bawdy jokes to gain the love of the crowds. Others will disguise themselves as fairy godmothers to capture the love of children. Whatever the means, they use every advantage they can.

entries.name: Saboteurs
entries: It is not enough for a hocus hag to simply be loved. Others must be loved less than her. To accomplish this, these spiteful hags will strive to defame any who the believe are loved more than them. The reputations of priests, politicians, and heroes are all subject to venomous gossip and damning coincidences, none of which ever seem to be connected to the hag herself. Any strangers that come to their beleaguered towns find themselves strangely unwelcome as vicious rumors about them spread.

entries.name: Emotional
entries: Though hocus hags like to affect a sweet, benevolent facade, they are in fact seething cauldrons of jealousy. Even a small slight or a tiny insult can cause them to explode into rage, twisting their faces into hideous masks no matter the disguise they currently wear. This leads to them killing many of the people whom they strive to force into loving them, whether out of fury or out of necessity to hide one of their outbursts. These people do not go to waste, though, as hocus hags are skilled at cooking the livers of the young to extract the vitality from them.

entries.name: A Hocus Hag's Lair
entries: A hocus hag never lives in any home that appears run down or ramshackle. They insist on every available surface being covered in nick-nacks, paintings, doilies, and other accoutrements. The overwhelming tackiness of their homes is further worsened by the nauseatingly sweet perfumes they favor.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: A hocus hag that has attained the status of grandmother or auntie may have a handful of lair actions available to it. Consult {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters} pg. 59 for more detail on hag lair actions. Those actions happen on Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties).

items: An overwhelmingly sweet odor of flowers fills a 20-foot cube that the hag can see in her lair and remains until initiative count 20 of the next round. Any creature that starts its turn in that space must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful hocus hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Reflections in mirrors portray creatures as being less attractive than they actually are, displaying minor flaws at first such as blemishes and poorly styled hair, which eventually increase to major flaws such as asymmetrical features and crooked teeth.

entries: When the hag dies, this effect fades after {@dice 1d4} days.

monster.name: Elder Hocus Hag

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The elder hocus hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the elder hocus hag fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The elder hocus hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Enchanting Song
entries: The elder hocus hag begins singing a magical melody. The song can only affect humanoids and giants of a specific level of maturity, which the elder hocus hag decides when she begins singing. Those levels are children, teenagers, adults, or eldery. Every humanoid and giant of the selected level of maturity within 300 ft. of the elder hag that can hear the song must succeed on a {dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. The elder hag must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. The elder hag can provide verbal components for spells and maintain concentration on spells while singing this song. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the elder hag is {@condition incapacitated}.

While {@condition charmed} by the elder hocus hag in this way, a target is affected as if by the {@spell suggestion} spell, the command for which need not be included in the song. The effect ends on a creature if the hag or her allies does anything to harm the creature or if the creature is exposed to sunlight. If a creature remains {@condition charmed} in this way for 3 uninterrupted minutes, the suggestion effect of the song persists for 8 more hours until otherwise ended.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this elder hocus hag's song for the next 24 hours.

bonus.name: Empower Cleaning Implement
entries: The elder hocus hag can enchant any cleaning implement that she can easily lift to behave as a {@item broom of flying} for as long as she remains in contact with it.

legendaryHeader: The elder hocus hag can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The elder hocus hag regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Attack.
entries: The elder hocus hag makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Curse (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elder hocus hag casts {@spell bestow curse}.

legendary.name: Razzle Dazzle (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elder hocus hag strikes a pose and casts {@spell color spray} from her Innate Spellcasting. When cast in this manner, the spell affects a sphere with a 10-foot radius centered on the elder hocus hag.

The hocus hags are strange among their kind, as they are obsessed with attaining the adoration of others. In their true forms, they have dull grey skin and barely more than a few strands of thin, stringy hair on their heads. However, this is rearely seen, as they use every tool at their disposal to make themselves seem as appealing as possible. Elaborate makeup, expensive dresses, illusory charms, magical enchantments, transformative potions, nothing is of limits in their goal to secure the love and adoration of every creature they meet.

They take a wide range of approaches towards achieving this. Some will become divas, performing spectacularly dramatic arias or telling bawdy jokes to gain the love of the crowds. Others will disguise themselves as fairy godmothers to capture the love of children. Whatever the means, they use every advantage they can.

entries.name: Covens
entries: An elder hocus hag that is part of a coven (see the “Hag Covens” sidebar in the {@i Monster Manual}) has a challenge rating of 8 (2,300 XP).

entries.name: A Hocus Hag's Lair
entries: A hocus hag never lives in any home that appears run down or ramshackle. They insist on every available surface being covered in nick-nacks, paintings, doilies, and other accoutrements. The overwhelming tackiness of their homes is further worsened by the nauseatingly sweet perfumes they favor.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: A hocus hag that has attained the status of grandmother or auntie may have a handful of lair actions available to it. Consult {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters} pg. 59 for more detail on hag lair actions. Those actions happen on Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties).

items: An overwhelmingly sweet odor of flowers fills a 20-foot cube that the hag can see in her lair and remains until initiative count 20 of the next round. Any creature that starts its turn in that space must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful hocus hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Reflections in mirrors portray creatures as being less attractive than they actually are, displaying minor flaws at first such as blemishes and poorly styled hair, which eventually increase to major flaws such as asymmetrical features and crooked teeth.

entries: When the hag dies, this effect fades after {@dice 1d4} days.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The marzanna hag’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1e: {@spell dream} ({@i can be cast while hibernating})

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The marzanna hag regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the marzanna hag takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the marzanna hag's next turn. The marzanna hag dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Return
entries: The marzanna hag will revive with full hit points 7 days after dying unless her corpse is immolated and then submerged in water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marzanna hag uses her Dreadful Eye if available. She then makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dreadful Eye {@recharge 4}
entries: The marzanna hag targets one creature that she can see within 30 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. However, if the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it immediately drops to 0 hit points.

If a humanoid is reduced to 0 hit points while under the effects of the marzanna hag’s Dreadful Eye, it immediately dies and its spirit rises from its body in {@dice 1d4} rounds as a {@creature specter}, which remains for 24 hours. These spirits are loyal to the marzanna hag, though they retain all their memories of life.

A marzanna hag is a personification of death and winter. Hunched and withered, these hags have marble white skin and black, frostbitten claws, and they gaze out at the world with yellow, baleful eyes. They cover themselves in poorly cured furs and crudely woven garments of straw decorated with skulls, bones, beads, and bits of hair. These hags take particular delight in eroding the faith of common folk in authority, and will take pains to sabotage roads with avalanches and to levy plagues and famine on those sheltering from the cruelty of winter to convince the common folk that those in power don’t care about them.

entries.name: Sister Winter
entries: Villages with a resident marzanna hag nearby fear the coming of winter. During the warm months the marzanna sleeps soundly in deep caverns, creeping through the dreams of mortals while they wait for winter to return. When the snow finally falls the marzanna awakens and begins to plague the surrounding countryside with undead spirits, foul diseases, and terrible misfortunes. Even death is not truly a release from the horror of a marzanna hag, as she can bind the spirits of the dead to an endless torment in the waking world.

entries.name: Goddess of Death
entries: Marzanna hags have a great deal of power over the process of death. They can tell how soon a creature will die by sense of smell, they can summon and control the spirits of the dead, and they can drain the life from the living with a mere touch. Many villagers that live near a marzanna hag are frightened into worshipping her like a goddess, leaving offerings for her in the hopes of placating her. These only work because they convince the hag to not kill and eat them outright, but some foolish people believe that by tricking the marzanna hag they can avoid death itself. These people often live long enough to regret their hubris.

entries.name: Always Return
entries: A marzanna hag is almost impossible to kill. Their skins are as tough as leather and their flesh regenerates at an alarming rate if not cauterized with flame. Even if slain, the hag’s corpse will return to life within a week if not first burned then drowned, no matter how mutilated the corpse is. For the eldest among, even that may not be enough.

entries.name: A Marzanna Hag's Lair
entries: A marzanna hag makes her lair near or within a well-hidden mountain cave, allowing her to remain defended while she sleeps during the warm months. Skinned animal pelts adorn every available surface.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: A marzanna hag that has attained the status of grandmother or auntie may have a handful of lair actions available to it. Consult {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters} pg. 59 for more detail on hag lair actions. Those actions happen on Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties).

Marzanna hags maintain an awareness of their lairs even while hibernating during the warm months. Though they cannot wake up before winter comes, they can still observe events within their lair as if with {@spell arcane eye} and can take lair actions that don’t require them to move.

items: The air within a 30 foot cube that the hag can see becomes bitterly cold. Creatures within the area only recover half as much from healing magic as they normally would. If a creature attempts to drink a potion within the area, the potion freezes solid for 1 minute.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful marzanna hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: The marzanna hag becomes aware when a creature is sleeping within the area and can cast {@spell dream} on it without knowing its name so long as it remains within the area.
Undead in the area display an unusual amount of cunning, and even zombies are capable of basic strategy.

entries: If the hag is killed but her body is not immolated and then submerged in water, these effects remain. Otherwise, these effects fade after a month, at which point the undead become inanimate.

monster.name: Elder Marzanna Hag

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The elder marzanna hag’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
will: {@spell dream} ({@i can be cast while hibernating})

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The elder marzanna hag regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn. If the elder marzanna hag takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the elder marzanna hag's next turn. The elder marzanna hag dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries: The elder marzanna hag will revive with full hit points 7 days after dying unless her corpse is immolated and then submerged in water.

entries: If the elder marzanna hag fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The elder marzanna hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elder marzanna hag uses her Dreadful Eye if available. She then makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dreadful Eye {@recharge 4}
entries: The elder marzanna hag targets one creature that she can see within 30 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. However, if the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it immediately drops to 0 hit points.

If a humanoid is reduced to 0 hit points while under the effects of the elder marzanna hag’s Dreadful Eye, it immediately dies and its spirit rises from its body in {@dice 1d4} rounds as a {@creature specter}, which remains for 24 hours. These spirits are loyal to the elder marzanna hag, though they retain all their memories of life.

legendaryHeader: The elder hag can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The elder hag regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The elder hag makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Curse (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elder hag casts {@spell bestow curse}.

legendary.name: Cower! (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elder hag speaks a word of power. All creatures of the elder hag’s choice within 30 feet of her that can hear her must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

A marzanna hag is a personification of death and winter. Hunched and withered, these hags have marble white skin and black, frostbitten claws, and they gaze out at the world with yellow, baleful eyes. They cover themselves in poorly cured furs and crudely woven garments of straw decorated with skulls, bones, beads, and bits of hair. These people often live long enough to regret their hubris.

entries.name: Covens
entries: A marzanna hag that is part of a coven (see the “Hag Covens” sidebar in the {@i Monster Manual}) has a challenge rating of 14 (11,500XP).

An elder marzanna hag has received centuries of worship from terrified commoners, and she has become accustomed to being obeyed. Elder marzannas have spent ages accumulating undead spirits, and their lairs are crawling with the foul beings. Even when they sleep, their presence can be felt in the lingering dread.

entries.name: A Marzanna Hag's Lair
entries: A marzanna hag makes her lair near or within a well-hidden mountain cave, allowing her to remain defended while she sleeps during the warm months. Skinned animal pelts adorn every available surface.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: A marzanna hag that has attained the status of grandmother or auntie may have a handful of lair actions available to it. Consult {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters} pg. 59 for more detail on hag lair actions. Those actions happen on Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties).

Marzanna hags maintain an awareness of their lairs even while hibernating during the warm months. Though they cannot wake up before winter comes, they can still observe events within their lair as if with {@spell arcane eye} and can take lair actions that don’t require them to move.

items: The air within a 30 foot cube that the hag can see becomes bitterly cold. Creatures within the area only recover half as much from healing magic as they normally would. If a creature attempts to drink a potion within the area, the potion freezes solid for 1 minute.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful marzanna hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: The marzanna hag becomes aware when a creature is sleeping within the area and can cast {@spell dream} on it without knowing its name so long as it remains within the area.
Undead in the area display an unusual amount of cunning, and even zombies are capable of basic strategy.

entries: If the hag is killed but her body is not immolated and then submerged in water, these effects remain. Otherwise, these effects fade after a month, at which point the undead become inanimate.

entries.name: Contingency Plans
entries: An elder marzanna hag has been around long enough to learn how to ensure that her spirit lingers even if her body is destroyed, and she may have a contingency plan in place in case she is truly killed.

items: {@b Pysanka.} A pysanka is a blown eggshell painted with intricate colorful symbols and containing one of her own severed toes. If the pysanka is buried in soil or sand and the hag is killed, her spirit journeys to the egg, which regrows her body over the course of 8 months. If the hag finishes regrowing and it is not winter, she enters a state of hibernation until winter and is not negatively affected by being buried underground. When winter comes, the hag emerges from the egg.

{@b Golodmora.} When the hag is slain, her spirit lingers in the form of a hungry ghost, a golodmora. In order to achieve this, the hag must inscribe her flesh with an intricate pattern of tattoos over the course of decades. When killed, the hag's spirit rises from her corpse the following midnight as a {@creature ghost}. If the hag's ghost possesses a teenaged female, she can perform a ritual to transform her body into that of a marzanna hag. The hag knows exactly where the creature that dealt the killing blow to her is so long as they are on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Potions
entries: The mojan hag carries a variety of potions on her at all times. These potions can either be drunk by the mojan hag or thrown as a ranged weapon (see {@i Throw Potion} action). The mojan hag has the following potions on her person. Any creature other than the mojan hag can only be under the continuous effects of one the mojan hag's potions at a time. The mojan hag is immune to any effect caused by the potions, unless she wishes to be under it.

items: {@b Potion of Fire Resistance (2 bottles).} Acts as a {@item potion of fire resistance}.
{@b Potion of Harming (6 bottles).} The target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d4 + 4} necrotic damage on a failure or half as much on a success.
{@b Potion of Healing (1 bottle).} Acts as a {@item potion of greater healing}.
{@b Potion of Speed (1 bottle).} Acts as a {@item potion of speed}.
{@b Potion of Poison (2 bottles).} Acts as a {@item potion of poison}.
{@b Potion of Slowness (2 bottles).} The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be affected as if by the {@spell slow} spell
{@b Potion of Water Breathing (2 bottles).} Acts as a {@item potion of water breathing}.
{@b Potion of Weakness (2 bottles).} The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be affected as if by the {@spell ray of enfeeblement} spell.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Throw Potion
entries: The mojan hag throws a one of her potions at a point within 30 feet of her. Any creatures within 5 feet of that point are splashed with the potion and subjected to its effects.

Mojan hags are potion makers, and they despise the sight of civilization. They look like thickset old crones with hunched, crabbed postures and lightning scarred skin. They favor purples, greens, and black in their clothing and always wear pointed hats. They shamble through the swamps, forests, and caves they call home, their bodies twitching and their noses wiggling as they chuckle darkly.

entries.name: Potion Masters
entries: Mojan hags are among the most brilliant alchemists in the world. They can craft some of the rarest and most potent of potions using the most innocuous of ingredients. Of course, this does not come without drawbacks, and the potions a mojan hag makes require frequent attention in order to keep their potency. Most remarkable of all, though, the mojan hags possess the innate ability to enchant their potions to effect creatures that they merely splash on, allowing them to throw their potions as weapons.

entries.name: A Mojan Hag's Lair
entries: Mojan hags prefer to lair near sources of water and exotic plantlife, usually in broad houses supported above the water on stilts. Their houses are often patrolled by cats, which mojan hags have a particular fondness for.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: A mojan hag that has attained the status of grandmother or auntie may have a handful of lair actions available to it. Consult {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters} pg. 59 for more detail on hag lair actions. Those actions happen on Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties).

items: The mojan hag refills one of the potions that she has already expended. Once she has used this lair action to refill a potion, she cannot use this lair action to refill this potion again for 24 hours.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful mojan hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Giant spiders are unusually common within the area, and are always hostile towards humanoids. Humanoids that die in this area while poisoned by spider venom may be animated, rising up as zombies or skeletons.

entries: When the hag dies, this effect fades after {@dice 1d4} days.

entries.name: Variants: Other Potions
entries: Mojan hags are incredibly proficient potion brewers. The statistics provided in this supplement represent the most common array of potions that mojan hags will likely carry with them. However, a mojan hag can have any array of potions on its person. These can be selected from already existing potions, such as {@item potion of dimunition} or {@item potion of giant strength}, or mimic the effects of spells such as {@spell confusion} or {@spell stoneskin}.

The potions that mojan hags carry with them only remain potent for 24 hours after it was brewed, after which point they all become {@item potion of poison}, though {@spell identify} will still identify them as their original potions. Assume that a potion in a mojan hag's possession had {@dice 2d12 - 1} hours of potency left. Mojan hags possess the knowledge of how to extend the potency period of their potions for an additional 24 hours.

monster.name: Elder Mojan Hag

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Potions
entries: The elder mojan hag carries a variety of potions on her at all times. These potions can either be drunk by the elder mojan hag or thrown as a ranged weapon (see {@i Throw Potion} action). The elder mojan hag has the following potions on her person. Any creature other than the elder mojan hag can only be under the continuous effects of one the elder mojan hag's potions at a time. The elder mojan hag is immune to any effect caused by the potions, unless she wishes to be under it.

items: {@b Potion of Fire Resistance (4 bottles).} Acts as a {@item potion of fire resistance}.
{@b Potion of Harming (6 bottles).} The target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6 + 6} necrotic damage on a failure or half as much on a success.
{@b Potion of Healing (3 bottle).} Acts as a {@item potion of greater healing}.
{@b Potion of Speed (2 bottle).} Acts as a {@item potion of speed}.
{@b Potion of Poison (2 bottles).} Acts as a {@item potion of poison}.
{@b Potion of Slowness (3 bottles).} The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be affected as if by the {@spell slow} spell
{@b Potion of Water Breathing (3 bottles).} Acts as a {@item potion of water breathing}.
{@b Potion of Sickness (2 bottles).} The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be affected as if by the {@spell cloudkill} spell.
{@b Potion of Polymorphism (1 bottle).} The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be affected as if by the {@spell polymorph} spell.
{@b Potion of Reincarnation (1 bottle).} A humanoid being imbibed with this potion is affected as if by the {@spell reincarnate} spell.
{@b Potion of the Death Guardian (1 bottle).} A humanoid or fey that drinks this potion is affected as if by the {@spell death ward} spell.
{@b Potion of Flying (2 bottles).} Acts as a {@item potion of flying}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the elder mojan hag fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The elder mojan hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elder mojan hag makes one claw attack and one throw potion action.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Throw Potion
entries: The elder mojan hag throws a one of her potions at a point within 30 feet of her. Any creatures within 5 feet of that point are splashed with the potion and subjected to its effects.

legendaryHeader: The elder mojan hag can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The elder mojan hag regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The elder mojan hag makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Curse (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elder mojan hag casts {@spell bestow curse} ({@dc 16}).

legendary.name: Smokebomb (2 bottles)
entries: The elder mojan hag throws a bottle at a point within 30 feet of her. A 20-foot-radius sphere of yellow, nauseating gas centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The cloud remains for 1 minute or until dispersed. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round. Each creature other than the hag that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against poison. On a failed save, the creature spends its action that turn retching and reeling. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw.

Mojan hags are potion makers, and they despise the sight of civilization. They look like thickset old crones with hunched, crabbed postures and lightning scarred skin. They favor purples, greens, and black in their clothing and always wear pointed hats. They shamble through the swamps, forests, and caves they call home, their bodies twitching and their noses wiggling as they chuckle darkly.

entries.name: Potion Masters
entries: Mojan hags are among the most brilliant alchemists in the world. They can craft some of the rarest and most potent of potions using the most innocuous of ingredients. Of course, this does not come without drawbacks, and the potions a mojan hag makes require frequent attention in order to keep their potency. Most remarkable of all, though, the mojan hags possess the innate ability to enchant their potions to effect creatures that they merely splash on, allowing them to throw their potions as weapons.

entries.name: Covens
entries: An elder mojan hag that is part of a coven (see the “Hag Covens” sidebar in the {@i Monster Manual}) has a challenge rating of 11 (7,200XP).

Elder mojan hags have spent centuries perfecting their craft, leading them to create a wide variety of potions with many strange effects. Their potions can grant flight, transform men into beasts, even change race or stave off death. They've also perfected the technique for crafting special potions that produce clouds of choking smoke which they are immune to but others which debilitates others with its foul odor.

entries.name: A Mojan Hag's Lair
entries: Mojan hags prefer to lair near sources of water and exotic plantlife, usually in broad houses supported above the water on stilts. Their houses are often patrolled by cats, which mojan hags have a particular fondness for.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: A mojan hag that has attained the status of grandmother or auntie may have a handful of lair actions available to it. Consult {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters} pg. 59 for more detail on hag lair actions. Those actions happen on Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties).

items: The mojan hag refills one of the potions that she has already expended. Once she has used this lair action to refill a potion, she cannot use this lair action to refill this potion again for 24 hours.

entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful mojan hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Giant spiders are unusually common within the area, and are always hostile towards humanoids. Humanoids that die in this area while poisoned by spider venom may be animated, rising up as zombies or skeletons.

entries: When the hag dies, this effect fades after {@dice 1d4} days.

entries.name: Variants: Other Potions
entries: Mojan hags are incredibly proficient potion brewers. The statistics provided in this supplement represent the most common array of potions that mojan hags will likely carry with them. However, a mojan hag can have any array of potions on its person. These can be selected from already existing potions, such as {@item potion of dimunition} or {@item potion of giant strength}, or mimic the effects of spells such as {@spell confusion} or {@spell stoneskin}.

The potions that mojan hags carry with them only remain potent for 24 hours after it was brewed, after which point they all become {@item potion of poison}, though {@spell identify} will still identify them as their original potions. Assume that a potion in a mojan hag's possession had {@dice 2d12 - 1} hours of potency left. Mojan hags possess the knowledge of how to extend the potency period of their potions for an additional 24 hours.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The powler hag can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The powler hag has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks while surrounded by ample vegetation.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The powler hag has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The powler hag has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Drag and Drown
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}The target creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) and must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check or be dragged by the powler hag up to the hag's speed.

Powler hags are a wretched breed of hag that lairs in stagnant ponds, swamps, and fens and delights in drowning children and the elderly. Their nauseous green bodies are bloated and revolting, like drowned corpses, and their hair is long and stringy like algae. They lurk amid pond scum and river weeds, waiting for the perfect moment to lunge out and drag their victims to an untimely end.

entries.name: Ambushers
entries: A powler hag never attacks head on, always preferring to ambush her prey, whether it be from the depths of a stagnant swamp or from the branches of a tree, which powler hags are surprisingly adept at climbing. Powler hags are especially fond of watching people suffocate to death, whether by drowning or by choking, and love finding all manner of new ways to rob the breath of their victims.

entries.name: Mysteries in the Moors
entries: Powler hags love mysteries, particularly mysteries that involve disappearances or death. More specifically, they love creating these mysteries. The uncertain grief of an unexplained disappearance or the lingering fear of a mysterious death is far more satisfying to a powler hag than simply drowning someone, though they take great delight in simple drownings as well. Conversely, when one of their mysteries is solved, a powler hag is liable to go into a rage. They keep their ears open, listening for any new opportunities to create a disappearance, as well as looking for anyone getting close to solving the murders they've already committed.

entries.name: A Powler Hag's Lair
entries: A powler hag always chooses a lair that is mostly submerged, favoring lairs that allow her to never leave the comfort of the water. Many of a powler hag's treasures and spells require that they be stored out of the water, so her lair will always feature an area that is not underwater. Additionally, they often feature convenient access to easily climbed trees.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: A Powler hag that has attained the status of grandmother or auntie may have a handful of lair actions available to it. Consult {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters} pg. 59 for more detail on hag lair actions. Those actions happen on Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties).

items: All plantlife within 15 feet of the hag becomes overgrown. Moving through the area costs 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot moved for all creatures other than the hag, which is unhindered. The hag also has three quarter cover while within this area. The plants wither away and die on initiative count 20 of the next turn.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful powler hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Pond scum grows in great profusion on the surface of still waters within the area, concealing anything that moves beneath the water. Additionally, the bright green pond scum can easily fool the unwary into mistaking water for solid ground, requiring a successful {@dc 17} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check or a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) or Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) check to correctly identify.

entries: If the hag dies, this effect fade after {@dice 2d6} days.

monster.name: Elder Powler Hag

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The elder powler hag can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The elder powler hag has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks while surrounded by ample vegetation.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The elder powler hag has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The elder powler hag has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the elder powler hag fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The elder powler hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elder powler hag makes one claw attack and then use her Drag and Drown attack as a bonus action if she successfully hit.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Drag and Drown
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}The target creature is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 15}) and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check or be dragged by the elder powler hag up to the elder hag's speed. If the movement made with this attack cause an attack of opportunity, the elder powler hag benefits from half cover.

legendaryHeader: The elder powler hag can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The elder powler hag regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The elder powler hag makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Curse (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elder powler hag casts {@spell bestow curse} ({@dc 14}).

legendary.name: Pond Scum (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The elder powler hag fills the water in a 30-foot radius centered on her with algae, heavily obscuring the area. The algae remains for 1 minute before withering away and disappearing.

Powler hags are a wretched breed of hag that lairs in stagnant ponds, swamps, and fens and delights in drowning children and the elderly. Their nauseous green bodies are bloated and revolting, like drowned corpses, and their hair is long and stringy like algae. The hag also has three quarter cover while within this area. The plants wither away and die on initiative count 20 of the next turn.

entries: The region within 1 mile of a powerful powler hag's lair is warped by her magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Pond scum grows in great profusion on the surface of still waters within the area, concealing anything that moves beneath the water. Additionally, the bright green pond scum can easily fool the unwary into mistaking water for solid ground, requiring a successful {@dc 20} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check or a successful {@dc 17} Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) or Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) check to correctly identify.

entries: If the hag dies, this effect fade after {@dice 2d6} days.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The dancing cauldron is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an {@i antimagic field}. If targeted by {@i dispel magic}, the dancing cauldron must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the dancing cauldron remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cauldron.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Scald (Recharges after being refilled with boiling water)
entries: The cauldron splashes its scalding hot contents over a single creature within 5 feet of it, emptying itself of water. The creature must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failure or half as much on a success.

entries.name: Animated Objects
entries: Hags are particularly fond of using magically animated objects to guard their homes and give their intruders a nasty surprise. Animated tables, animated stoves, brooms of animated attack, and rugs of smothering are just some of the many cunning objects that hags love to use to defend their lairs.

Dancing caludrons are animated cauldrons, large enough to fit an entire man into, that when active dance about, splashing their contents everywhere. They are capable of dousing an unfortunate victim with boiling liquid, scalding them horribly before crushing them into a greasy smear with their scorching hot bodies.

entries.name: Companion Creatures
entries: Dancing cauldrons, while formidable on their own, are rarely encountered alone. Often times they are paired with flying spoons, which can utilize the boiling water they contain to great effect. Other times, they may contain creatures such as water weirds or swarms of supernatural insects which burst out of them.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The spoon is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an {@i antimagic field}. If targeted by {@i dispel magic}, the spoon must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the dancing cauldron remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal spoon.

action.name: Smack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 ‒1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Scalding Splash (Can only be used while within 5 feet of a source of boiling water)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) fire damage.

entries.name: Animated Objects
entries: Hags are particularly fond of using magically animated objects to guard their homes and give their intruders a nasty surprise. Animated tables, animated stoves, brooms of animated attack, and rugs of smothering are just some of the many cunning objects that hags love to use to defend their lairs.

Flying spoons are long spoons that chase their victims and strike them mercilessly. They are often found in concert with dancing cauldrons, as they can direct streams of scalding liquid at their victims.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The cutlery is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an {@i antimagic field}. If targeted by {@i dispel magic}, the cutlery must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the dancing cauldron remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal pile of utensils.

trait.name: Swarm (Swarm of Bats)
entries: The swarm of cutlery can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny utensil. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Smack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Animated Objects
entries: Hags are particularly fond of using magically animated objects to guard their homes and give their intruders a nasty surprise. Animated tables, animated stoves, brooms of animated attack, and rugs of smothering are just some of the many cunning objects that hags love to use to defend their lairs.

Swarms of cutlery are made of dozens of knives and forks, all flying about like a swarm of wasps. They may remain docile within a drawer until they detect an intruder, at which point they emerge en force.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the ash rat is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Smoky Hide
entries: The rat can begins to emit smoke or stop emitting it as a free action. The smoke fills the space the rat occupies. The smoke heavily obscures the area. A strong wind blows this smoke away.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage, plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage.

action.name: Spit Fire {@recharge 6}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

An ash rat is a creature of fire and soot formed when a rat is tortured and burned alive by evil magic. They appear to be made of ash and fur in the shape of a rat and continually emitting sparks and billows of dirty smoke. They gain sustenance from the process of burning things, and as such are incredibly dangerous where ever they emerge.

entries.name: Swarms of Revenge
entries: Typically these monsters are made purposefully by hags, as they are relatively easy to create. These ash rats are typically kept trapped in the hag's oven and fed kindling until such time as they are released into an unsuspecting home or city, at which point they run amok, burning all that they encounter. However, they may occasionally be born from the corpses of rats that died during a wildfire in a forest or a city, forming a swarm of destruction a few days after the initial tragedy only to repeat the tragedy all over again.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the swarm is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Smoky Hide
entries: The swarm can begins to emit smoke or stop emitting it as a free action. The smoke fills the space the rat occupies. The smoke heavily obscures the area. A strong wind blows this smoke away for the duration that the wind is blowing.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points except through its Fire Absorption trait.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 6d4}) piercing damage, plus 15 ({@damage 6d4}) fire damage, or 7 ({@damage 3d4}) plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) fire damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Spit Fire {@recharge 6}
entries: The swarm exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, it only deals 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

They appear to be made of ash and fur in the shape of a rat and continually emitting sparks and billows of dirty smoke. They gain sustenance from the process of burning things, and as such are incredibly dangerous where ever they emerge.

entries: Typically these monsters are made purposefully by hags, as they are relatively easy to create. These ash rats are typically kept trapped in the hag's oven and fed kindling until such time as they are released into an unsuspecting home or city, at which point they run amok, burning all that they encounter. However, they may occasionally be born from the corpses of rats that died during a wildfire in a forest or a city, forming a swarm of destruction a few days after the initial tragedy only to repeat the tragedy all over again.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the dogai has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the dogai scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the dogai's darkvision.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the dogai is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the dogai instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Fog Cloud
entries: The devil can innately {@spell cast fog} cloud at will, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dogai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Once per turn, the dogai deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the dogai that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the dogai doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devil makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Dark Cunning
entries: On each of its turns, the devil can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action. While in dim light or darkness, the devil's stealth bonus is also improved to {@hit 15}.

bonus.name: Unseen Step
entries: If the dogai is not being observed at the start of its turn, it can use a bonus action to teleport to an unoccupied space within 60 feet of it. The destination need not be within line of sight if it is in dim light or darkness.

These devils are the premiere assassins of the Hells and are made from raw, primeval darkness. With night black skin, a broad, bony smile locked into a rictus grin, and the ability to move noiselessly, an assassun devil is an unnerving foe to fight for even battle hardened veterans. These devils never speak, communicating only through telepathy.

entries.name: Primeval Shadow
entries: When Baator was still young and Asmodeus still establishing his rule over the untamed evil of the realm, even the shadows themselves possessed life. Cruel, malevolent things, they lurked on the edges of the realm, picking off any creature foolish enough to wander among them alone. Asmodeus ordered that all such shadows be rounded up and poured into massive cauldrons attended to by night hags and pit fiends. The shadows were forged into devils who answer only to Asmodeus and the darkness from which they were forged.

entries.name: Outside the Hierarchy
entries: Assassin devils exist outside the typical hierarchy of the Nine Hells, and no other devils trust them. They have free reign to kill any devil they wish without fear of direct legal reprisal. The only laws to which an assassin devil are held are the laws of the contract that they accept, and they are under no compunction to accept any particular contract. Only Asmodeus has the direct authority to punish them for their actions. As a result, they are free to pursue assassinations against any devil they wish, no matter how high in the hierarchy they reside, save for against Asmodeus himself. Despite the mistrust that other devils bear for them, the dogai are still very much in demand. Interestingly, dogai will not willingly kill another dogai, and if ordered to do will merely fight to submission.

entries.name: The Dark Beneath the Plane
entries: When Asmodeus crafted the dogai, he gave shape to the primeval darkness that preceded the existence of his empire. Some even believe he may have brokered a deal with the darkness itself. As a result, though he can command them to obey, their true loyalty is ultimately to the darkness beneath the Hells. The dogai do not fear the voice of Magoth Thym, for they were born from the shadows from which the howling comes.

entries.name: The Command of the Hag Countess
entries: Malagard serves the darkness beneath Magoth Thym and is the only being in the multiverse aside from Asmodeus who can command the assassin devils. The hags of the multiverse know this, and they know hat they can broker deals with Malagard in secret to commission the use of these deadly fiends in exchange for payment in souls or magic items.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the broodswarm is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Call Mother (1/Day)
entries: The swarm can attempt to magically summon the hag that created it. In order to do so, the broodswarm must use its action and movement on each consecutive turn to perform a ritual for one uninterrupted minute performing a ritual. If successful, the hag is summoned into a space the swarm occupies at the end of the ritual. There is a 25% chance that the hag refuses the summon for whatever reason. If the hag refuses the summon or the ritual is interrupted, the ritual fails and its use for the day is wasted.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The broodswarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The broodswarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The broodswarm makes one melee attack against each creature in its space.

action.name: Stitching Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the broodswarm's space. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) piercing damage, or 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage fi the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. Additionally, on each successful hit, the swarm begins to stitch the target's limbs together. After one hit, the target has disadvantage on saving throws. After two hits, the target also has disadvantage on attack rolls. After three hits the target is {@condition restrained}. After four hits, the target's eyes, ears, and mouth are sewn shut, rendering it {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and unable to speak. The swarm can choose to cause non-lethal damage with this attack

A broodswarm is a horde of tiny, chittering demons with fat little bodies, over large heads, madly flapping vestigial wings, and claws like sewing needles. They are created by hags and are slavishly loyal to their mistresses, being incapable of disobeying them.

entries.name: Gruesome Birth
entries: The creation of a broodswarm is a long and gorey process. A hag must venture into the Abyss, where she must then corral a large number of ferocious manes demons. Then, in a ritual that takes a month of dedicated work, the hag must cut away tiny pieces of her flesh, feeding them to the slavering manes, which promptly shrink into the broodlings of the swarm. The process is costly and painful, reducing the hag's Constitution score by 2 for as long as the swarm lives, but the benefits of a broodswarm far outweigh its cost in the eyes of many hags.

entries.name: Loyal Children
entries: A broodswarm is unwaveringly loyal to its mother and obeys every order given by her no matter how strange or dangerous. Because of this unfaltering obedience, broodswarms are excellent thieves, guardians, and spies. Additionally, they possess the ability to summon the hags that created them, making them ideal infiltrators. However, their most valuable ability is as kidnappers.

entries.name: Stitching Claws
entries: Broodswarm broodlings possess strange, needle-like claws instead of hands. These claws produce a black thread which the broodlings can use to stitch the limbs of their victims together by working in concert. They are especially fond of ambushing sleeping victims, but even creatures that can fight back are all but helpless to fight back against their astonishing agility. Once their prey is secure, they will summon their mother or carry the prey off to wherever ordered.

monster.name: Cait Sith
languages: Common and the languages of its host

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cait sith's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The cait sith has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: The cait sith is indistinguishable from a normal cat.

trait.name: Host Dependent
entries: If the cait sith is not bonded to a living creature, it cannot use its Innate Spellcasting or Bad Luck reaction. A cait sith can become bonded to a creature if invited into its home or summoned as a familiar.

trait.name: Parasitic Familiar
entries: If the {@spell find familiar} spell is cast within 10 miles of the cait sith's location, the cait sith immediately becomes aware of it and can use a reaction to attempt to make itself the subject of the spell. The caster must succeed on a {@dc 13} saving throw using its spell attack roll or summon the cait sith instead of the intended familiar.

Once the cait sith has been summoned as a familiar it cannot be dismissed by its master unless it allows it, nor is it obligated to obey its master. If its master tries recasting {@spell find familiar}, even if the cait sith is dead, the spell will simply summon the cait sith again. The cait sith's bond to its summoner can be broken with a {@spell remove curse} spell of 5th level or higher, with the death of its summoner, or as a free action by the cait sith.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Bad Luck
entries: The cait sith imposes disadvantage on one saving throw, ability check, or attack roll being made by a creature within 60 feet of it that it can see.

The cait sith, also known as a midnight cat, appears to simply be a mundane black cat with an immaculate coat and striking green eyes. However, it is in actuality a sinister, intelligent creature that spreads bad luck and misfortune wherever it goes. Displaying a unique form of arcane parasitism, a cait sith must bond itself to a host in order to use its powers.

entries.name: Born of Misfortune
entries: The first cait siths were primitive druids who defied the goddess Beshaba and refused to worship her. As punishment, she transformed them into cats and trapped them on the plane of ghosts. When they eventually begged her to have mercy on them and to release them from that pale place, she released them back into the mortal plane on the condition that they spread misfortune on her behalf. Even today, if a cait sith fails to cause at least one misfortune per week, it fades into the Ethereal Plane until summoned back.

entries.name: Inviting it In
entries: Because a cait sith must cause misfortune to remain in the physical world, they strive to cause as much misfortune as possible. However, a cait sith can only use its magic to cause misfortune while bonded to a creature. A cait sith can only bond to a creature that voluntarily invites it into its home or summons it as a familiar. As a result, there are many folk tales about why black cats are bad luck, and why you should not invite them into your home.

entries.name: Parasitic Familiar
entries: When a spellcaster attempts to summon a familiar near a cait sith, it can attempt to force its way into the spell, causing itself to be summoned instead of the intended target. Once summoned, it is under no compunction to obey its master. Instead, it enjoys itself by creating misfortune for every creature it encounters. It enjoys tormenting its master by causing misfortune to both it and its allies.

entries.name: Hag Friends
entries: Many hags are fond of cait siths, which will willingly cooperate with these harridans in order to spread misfortune, misery, and evil. Some mortal spellcasters will attempt to do the same thing, but cait siths rarely stay loyal to a mortal master for long. However, devout worshippers of Beshaba and other gods of misfortune may receive obedience from a cait sith, at least for a time.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The haraknin has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The haraknin has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the haraknin's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The haraknin makes two attacks with either its spear or its longbow.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage in melee or at range, or 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with both hands to make a melee attack. If the haraknin uses this weapon to make a melee attack, it can force the target to make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition prone}

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target's speed is halved.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The haraknin exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Shapechange
entries: The haraknin can use a bonus action to magically polymorph into its {@creature hell hound} form or back into its humanoid form. It retains its Intelligence, Charisma, hit points, and this feature, but otherwise uses the statistics of a hell hound. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. It reverts to its hell hound form if it dies.

A canomorph is an fiendish hound that has gained the ability to transform into a humanoid form. Typically, it gains this ability from a powerful supernatural being such as an archdevil, an agent of the Raven Queen, or an ancient hag, though some develop this ability on their own.
