entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage in melee or at range, or 8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage white raging.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 25/100 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

action.name: War Chant (Only While Raging)
entries: The gabharchinn begins a rousing war chant. Every ally of the gabharchinn within 120 feet of it that can hear the chant gains the benefit of its Rage. The gabharchinn must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue chanting. It can stop chanting at any time. The chant ends if the gabharchinn is {@condition incapacitated} or if the gabharchinn stops raging.

bonus.name: Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The gabharchinn can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the gabharchinn is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the gabharchinn gains the following benefits:

items: The gabharchinn has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the gabharchinn gains a +2 bonus to the damage roll.
The gabharchinn has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entries: The gabharchinn are the satyrs of warfare. Taller and more powerfully muscled than their feckless kin, gabharchinn are hirsute and ferocious, cultivating immaculately maintained braids and beards to commemorate each foe that they have slain. They seek out armies to march in, singing their war chants to empower their allies with the glorious rage of battle and diving into battle with savage glee, felling foes with their horns and axes. Those that do not fall to the gabharchinn's fury and strength may still fall to the darts it carries, which are dipped in a sleep inducing poison. When a gabharchinn goes to war, it does not intend to leave survivors.

resist.note: damage from non-magical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Aolus Spellcasting
headerEntries: The marsyan's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). While the marsyan has its aolus on its person, it can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the marsyan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The marsyan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: Unless it is wearing another creature's skin, the marsyan takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight.

trait.name: Satirical Transformation
entries: The marsyan can use an hour of dedicated work to skin the corpse a humanoid creature that has been dead for no longer than 24 hours and wear its skin as its own. While wearing the skin, the marsyan is physically indistinguishable from the creature, and even takes on the creature's height, weight, voice, and smell. However, the marsyan must imitate the mannerisms itself. A creature that interacts with the marsyan and is familiar with the creature being imitated can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check contested by the marsyan's Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check. Additionally, the seam down the creature's back that the marsyan uses to put the skin on is visible as a noticeable scar, as is any damage that the creature's skin took prior to its death.

The skin remains functional for 1 week, after which it rapidly decomposes. The marsyan can put the skin on over the course of 10 minutes, and can remove it over the course of 1 minute. The marsyan can only have one such skin at a time.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marsyan can play its aolus. It then casts one spell or makes two attacks: one with its ram one with its stunning touch.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Stunning Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Cruel Joke
entries: The marsyan tells an insult filled joke at the expense of a creature that can hear it within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) psychic damage and have disadvantage on all attack rolls it makes before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Aolus
entries: The marsyan plays its aolus and chooses one of the following magical effects: a charming melody, a frightening strain, or a gentle lullaby. Any creature within 60 feet of the marsyan that can hear the aolus must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be affected as described below. Satyrs and creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are unaffected. Creatures that have not seen the marsyan's true form have disadvantage on the saving throw.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the marsyan's aolus for the next 24 hours. However, if the creature fails a saving throw by 5 or more or remains under the effects of the aulos for the duration, the effects of the song last for 24 hours unless removed with a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

items: {@b Charming Melody.} The creature is {@condition charmed} by the marsyan for 1 minute. If the marsyan or any of its companions harms the creature, the effect on it ends immediately.
{@b Frightening Strain.} The creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.
{@b Gentle Lullaby.} The creature falls asleep and is {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The effect ends if the creature takes damage or if someone takes an action to shake the creature awake.

legendary.name: Call Out
entries: The marsyan makes one cruel joke.

legendary.name: Skin Curse (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The marsyan targets one creature that is {@condition stunned} by its stunning touch. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

There is a power in comedy, a fact often overlooked by those who only recognize conventional strength. Humor can reveal the weaknesses of the powerful. Satire and parody can as easily turn a people against a just leader as it grants a tyrant the charm win over an unnerved crowd. Some satyrs saw a means to undermine the powerful, and in this found an intoxicating power to call their own. These satyrs pervert humor and music for their own cruel, destructive whims, to dominate and manipulate, to berate and insult. The most successful of these satyrs seek to ensconce themselves in everlasting power and, through dark research and wicked blasphemy, unlock the secrets of lichdom entirely unique to their kind, thus becoming marsyans.

entries.name: Flensed Satirists
entries: In order to become a marsyan, the satyr must create an aolus, a kind of two stemmed flute, from the wishbone of a noble hearted bird such as a giant owl or a giant eagle. It then binds its spirit to the aolus through a series of profane and abominable rituals of sadistic cruelty so that it may become its phylactery. Finally, in order to complete the process, the satyr must flay the skin from its own body. Only once this is done will it achieve the immortality it seeks in undeath.

entries.name: Cruel Jokes
entries: A marsyan in its natural form is hideous. Appearing as the flayed, half rotted corpse of a satyr, a marsyan is so horrifying to behold that even the sun is disgusted by it. However, a marsyan rarely takes on its natural form. Rather, it prefers to kill and flay humanoids so that it might wear their skin and impersonate them to engage in unrestrained hedonism and sadistic torment.

entries.name: Strange Rejuvination
entries: Unlike other liches, a marsyan cannot regenerate its body from its phylactery alone. Rather, it can only regenerate when its phylactery is claimed by a bard. It may take a long time for a bard to discover its aolus, but the nature of the object always draws suitable creatures to it eventually. The aolus appears to be an instrument of the bards, and indeed offers many of the same powers and abilities. However, a creature that uses this instrument places themselves at great peril, as doing so opens them up to possession by the marsyan spirit within. Once the spirit awakens and overtakes its host, it proceeds to slay its allies and then flay the skin from its body, becoming a marsyan once again.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nemanon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

3e: {@spell augury} ({@i no chance of incorrect readings})

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The nemanon can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Ghost Lord
entries: When an undead creature attacks the nemanon, that creature must make a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose another target or the attack automatically misses. The creature is aware of this effect before it makes its attack against the nemanon.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the nemanon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nemanon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Empowered Strikes
entries: The nemanon's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

trait.name: Magic Spear
entries: The nemanon's spear is a magical weapon which can be ridden as if it were a {@item broom of flying}. If the spear is destroyed, the nemanon can replace it with one week of dedicated work.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nemanon makes two attacks with its spear or touch.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage in melee or at range. As part of this attack, the nemanon can cast {@spell bestow curse} on the target.

action.name: Spear (Corporeal Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage in melee or at range, or 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with both hands, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) lightning damage. If thrown, the spear returns to the nemanon's hand at the end of its turn.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The nemanon enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

bonus.name: Sidhe Shape: Ghost
entries: The nemanon magically polymorphs into a ghost form or back into its corporeal form. All equipment that it is wearing or carrying merge into this form. In ghost form, the nemanon's statistics remain the same except for the following changes: it is ephemeral and cannot carry anything, it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain (taking 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object), and it is immune to being {@condition grappled}, knocked {@condition prone}, and {@condition restrained}.

legendary.name: Witch Hand
entries: The nemanon makes a touch attack, casts an at will spell from its Innate Spellcasting, or casts a 2nd-level or lower spell from its coven spellcasting if it is currently a part of a coven.

legendary.name: Ghost Step (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The nemanon uses its Etherealness action.

The nemanon are the true witches, the witches all mortal witches strive to be like. They tread the line between then and now, night and day, life and death. They rule over ghosts and those who are neither here nor there. They thread the fibers of fate between their fingers. They brew the mead of poetry and pour the blood of strength. They know of the divine and the mundane and they see how they meet and blend. The nemanon are the true masters of magic.

entries.name: Mediators of Nature
entries: The nemanon are rare, and are revered by fey and mortal witches alike for their understanding of magic and the natural world. Nemanon are intimately familiar with the politics of the pixies that change the seasons, with the secret wisdom of the dryads that tend to the forests, with the strange songs of the korred that wander deep below the earth. The nemanon understand the flow of energy through ley lines and they mediate disputes among the spirits of the land while protecting the land from abuse with their magical touch and their enchanted spears.

entries.name: Ghost Speakers
entries: Nemanon straddle the boundary between life and death, able to transform into ghostly spirits and step into the Ethereal Plane at will. They can travel among the dead without fear, for the spirits of the dead cannot bear to attack a nemanon. These witch fey can move beyond the boundaries of the physical realm, and may even travel to the Fugue Planes if the need arises.

entries.name: Dark and Light
entries: Nemanon walk the boundary between light and dark. They mediate between devils and angels, providing neutral ground for negotiations to take place and keeping the peace between them. However, some nemanon stray away from this position of neutrality and become white or dark witches. White nemanon ally with celestials, spending their time healing the wounds of the world and protecting mortals and fey alike from evil influences. Many white nemanon affiliate themselves with the Court of Stars and become true celestials. Dark nemanon, on the other hand, seek power and control, turning to necromancy and twisted enchantments to assert their will on the world. These nemanon often ally with hags, devils, or demons; many eventually become fiends themselves, descending into the Lower Planes to claim their position among the myriad wicked creatures there.

entries.name: Covens
entries: The nemanon are pure embodiments of witchcraft. As a result, a nemanon can join a coven with hags and counts as an elder hag for the purposes of forming an elder coven.

entries.name: Enchanted Draft
entries: Over the course of an hour of concentration, a nemanon can imbue up to 1 quart of water with magical power, transforming it into an enchanted draft. A willing creature that consumes at least 1 cup of the draft regains 70 hit points and is healed of {@condition blindness}, {@condition deafness}, and any diseases affecting it. Additionally, depending on the specific draft created, it also possesses on of the following additional effects, which apply for the next 24 hours:

items: {@b Pisoned Milk.} When an affected creature makes a weapon attack, it becomes overwhelmed with apathy. The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks and can't cast spells with harmful effects for the duration of the combat encounter.
{@b Blood of Strength.} An affected creature is immune to the charmed and frightened conditions and has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws while in combat.

{@b Mead of Poetry.} When the affected creature makes an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}), Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}), Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}), Charisma ({@skill Performance}) or Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) check, it automatically succeeds on the check if the DC is 20 or lower. If the DC is 21 or higher, it has advantage on the check.

entries: If not consumed within 1 hour or removed from its current vessel, the drink reverts back to water. The effects of the draft can be removed with a {@spell dispel evil and good} spell or similar magic. These drafts are considered potions for the purpose of consuming other potions.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The sluagh has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sluagh has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sluagh's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sluagh can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes two attacks with its greataxe.

action.name: Greataxe.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the sluagh's choice that is within 120 feet of the sluagh and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the sluagh's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Dominate
entries: The sluagh targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the sluagh, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the sluagh. The {@condition charmed} target regards the sluagh as a respected commander and must obey the letter of any command given to it by the sluagh.

Each time the sluagh or the sluagh's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the sluagh is killed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect. The sluagh can only have one humanoid under its control at a time.

action.name: Carrion Call (1/Day)
entries: The sluagh magically calls {@dice 3d6} swarms of ravens or {@dice 1d4} {@creature giant vulture}s, provided that it is outdoors. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the sluagh and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the sluagh dies, or until the sluagh dismisses them as a bonus action.

action.name: Create Sword Wraith
entries: The sluagh targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute, was a warrior, died violently, and had 6 or more Hit Dice. The target's spirit rises as a {@creature sword wraith warrior|MTF} in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The spirit is under the sluagh's control. The sluagh can have no more than seven spirits under its control at one time.

bonus.name: Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The sluagh can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the sluagh is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the sluagh gains the following benefits:

items: The sluagh has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the sluagh gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
The sluagh has immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

bonus.name: Sidhe Shape: Flock of Ravens
entries: The sluagh magically polymorphs into a flock of {@creature raven}s, or back into its humanoid form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. In flock of ravens form, the sluagh gains the statistics of a swarm of ravens, but retains its hit points, flying speed, alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and damage resistances and immunities. While in the form of a flock of ravens, its beaks attack is made at {@hit 10} to hit and deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

The sluagh are the savage fey of reckless slaughter, the carrion fey that feast on warfare and drink the blood of soldiers. Bare-chested and powerfully built, the sluagh soar above battlefields on black feathered wings, commanding obedience from the ravens and vultures that feast on the dead and the restless spirits that rise from their corpses. When nights grow dark and wing beats fill the air, the wise shutter their windows and shelter in place, hoping that these bloodthirsty lords of bloodshed pass them by.

entries.name: Commanding Terror
entries: A sluagh demands obedience through fear. A slaugh is virtually never without a company of terrorized mortal slaves, whose reward for obdience is mere survival. Those that will not submit to the sluagh's demands out of fear of death may find themselves dominated by the cruel fey, forced into submission through the sheer force of personality that the fey wields and made to commit profane acts of horrific violence. Those that still resist become the target for the sluagh's overwhelming rage, and once they lay dismembered on the earth the sluagh simply drags their soul back to the earth as a restless ghost to serve it even in undeath.

entries.name: Joy in Slaughter
entries: A sluagh commands the respect and loyalty of other creatures of wanton violence and warfare. When a sluagh rides into battle, the taste of blood on its tongue, it is always accompanied by a retinue of savage creatures such as red caps, peryton, and vicious satyrs bent on slaughter. Battle loving fiends such as yugoloths and vrock also ally themselves with sluagh, and hateful undead like specters and wraiths bolster their numbers, turning a sluagh's war host into a roiling cloud of shrieking terror that swoops across battlefields like a wave of death. When a battle cannot be found, a sluagh turns its attention on the innocent, gleefully razing villages to the ground and slaughtering women and children alike.

entries.name: Carrion Lord
entries: A sluagh revels not only in warfare, but in the aftermath as well. Once a battle concludes and its survivors have dragged themselves away, a sluagh descends in the form of a flock of savage birds to feast on the dead, accompanied by the crows, ravens, vultures, and other creatures of carrion that follow it. Possessing constitutions more robust than even the most resilient buzzard, a sluagh fears nothing of disease or poison and it can feast without fear on any dead that it finds. However, a sluagh does not need to wait for a creature to die before it feasts on it, and it will happily devour a person alive where they stand.

resist.note: damage from non-magical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The uncle skeleton's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Constrictor Snake Forbiddance
entries: The skeleton cannot willingly move into a space within 30 feet of a {@creature constrictor snake} or a {@creature giant constrictor snake}, such as a python, boa, or anaconda (this includes those summoned as fey by {@spell conjure woodland beings}). If the skeleton starts its turn in a space within 30 feet of a {@i constrictor snake}, it must spend its turn trying to move as far away from it as it can. For its action, it can use only the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the skeleton can use the {@action Dodge} action. It also can't take {@i reactions}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the uncle skeleton fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The uncle skeleton has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The uncle skeleton's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Ventriloquism
entries: Whenever the uncle skeletion speaks, it can choose a point within 60 feet; its voice emanates from that point.

trait.name: Turn Defiance
entries: Undead creatures friendly to the uncle skeleton within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Undead-like
entries: The uncle skelton benefits from desecrated ground as if it was undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The uncle skeleton can use its Greatest Showman or Command Undead action. It then makes two sword cane attacks.

action.name: Sword Cane
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Greatest Showman
entries: The uncle skeleton uses its mastery of showmanship to sway the emotions of those that can see it. All creatures with an Intelligence score of 5 or more within 30 feet of the uncle skeleton that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be affected in one of the following ways:

items: {@b Jest.} The affected creature begins laughing uncontrollably. The creature falls {@condition prone}, becoming {@condition incapacitated} and unable to stand up for the duration.
{@b Fear.} The affected creature is {@condition frightened}.
{@b Amaze.} The affected creature is {@condition stunned}.

entries: The effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to that effect of the uncle skeleton's Greatest Showman for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Command Undead
entries: The uncle skeleton speaks a command, limited to a sentence or two. All undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or obey the command. Undead with an Intelligence of 7 or lower automatically fail this saving throw. The command must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The uncle skeleton magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The uncle skeleton makes one sword cane attack.

legendary.name: Empower
entries: The uncle skeleton grants one undead creature it can see within 60 feet of it advantage on its next attack roll.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The uncle skeleton uses its Teleport action.

One part deranged carnival showman, one part skulking undead lord, and one part winking, good-natured relative, the uncle skeleton is an enigma. Though they appear to be nothing more than dancing skeletons, they are actually spirits that act as intermediaries between the living and the dead. They live in the Feywild reflections of graveyards, decorating their homes in gaudy tapestries, colorful flowers, glittering beads, and flickering candles, waited on hand and foot by skeletons, zombies, specters, and other undead beings. On nights when the boundary between the mortal world and the world of the dead become blurred, such as Samhain or the Ghost Festival, these spirits roam the realm of mortals in hearses festooned in colorful lanterns or sedan chairs made of bone, spreading fear and merriment in equal measure.

entries.name: Frights and Fun
entries: When an uncle skeleton roams, it uses its mastery of showmanship to both delight and disturb those that it encounters, putting on performances of thrills and chills the likes of which its audience have never seen. Though ghoulish in appearance and company, uncle skeletons aren't evil. They adore the living for their vitality and verve, and seem most interested in reminding people of the importance of enjoying life by means of reminding them of their own mortality. They will always reward those that they encounter who possess a good sense of humor and a passion for life, and those that give them gifts of rum and fine cigars will find these grotesque spirits even better disposed to them. Those that are dull, though, or show disrespect for the dead will be treated to a night full of terror as they are pursued mercilessly by skeletons and specters until the sun rises, or even frightened to death. Only a constrictor snake can halt an uncle skeleton's pursuit, as they cannot approach these sacred creatures of rebirth.

entries.name: Corpse Lords
entries: Uncle skeletons have power over the undead, being able to command lesser undead without question. They use these rotten minions to serve them in their homes and assist them in terrifying mortals when they travel abroad. However, they dislike most intelligent undead such as vampires and liches, as these creatures are invariably dull and serious-minded, lacking the verve and vitality that they once possessed in life. An uncle skeleton may even be persuaded to help a merry band of heroes in defeating a powerful undead, especially if plied with gifts of fine art, expensive fashion, and tobacco.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The unicorn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The unicorn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the unicorn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Dark Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the black unicorn's darkvision.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the black unicorn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The black unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Empowered Strikes
entries: The black unicorn's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The unicorn makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a success the creature is immune to this poison for 24 hours. Otherwise it becomes {@condition poisoned}. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature is {@condition paralyzed} and it cannot recover hit points. The target can repeat the saving throw each time it takes damage, as well as after finishing a long rest, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature fails the saving throw performed at the end of a long rest three times, its heart stops beating and it dies.

action.name: Teleport (1/Day)
entries: If it is within dim light or darkness, the unicorn magically teleports itself and up to three willing creatures it can see within 5 feet of it, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, to a location the unicorn is familiar with, up to 1 mile away. The destination must be in dim light or darkness.

bonus.name: Aura of Silence
entries: The unicorn can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the unicorn radiates a 15-foot-radius of silence. No sound can be created within or pass through the aura. Any creature or object entirely inside the aura is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are {@condition deafened} while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible in the aura, as is verbal communication.

legendary.name: Hooves
entries: The unicorn makes one attack with its hooves.

legendary.name: Shadow Teleport {@recharge 6}
entries: The unicorn teleports to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of it that it can see, provided that both the space it's teleporting from and its destination are in dim light or darkness.

The first unicorns were creatures of divine beauty and heartbreaking grace, and many continue to trot the path of focused, perfect elegance. However, some unicorns are drawn away from these divine origins, whether by birth or by tragedy. These are the dark unicorns.

Black unicorns are glossy jet black creatures with completely black eyes and horns of gleaming obsidian. They reside in caverns and dark forests, jealously guarding their realms from intruders with their venomous horns. They travel in silence, can see through any darkness, and brook no trespass.

entries.name: Pets of the Dark Queen
entries: The first black unicorns were bred by the Gloaming Court from unicorn stock to serve the Queen of Air and Darkness. Bred for strength and cunning, these unicorns are powerful defenders of the lands of the Gloaming Court. These unicorns never breed on their own and always serve a fey lord, guarding the borders of their assigned realm with the paralytic venom of their horns.

entries.name: Realms of Silence
entries: A black unicorn's territory is unsettlingly quiet. Unlike their kindhearted kin, black unicorns are carnivorous and feed on the creatures that make their homes in its domain, leading to an oppressive silence to pervade their realms. They can cloak themselves in this uncanny quiet, thus plunging their victims into a terrifying silent darkness.

entries.name: Dark Protectors
entries: Though uncaring of mortals, black unicorns are not divorced from the natural world. A black unicorn does not permit unnatural creatures such as evil undead or fiends to blight its land with their presence without explicit orders from their lord, and any creatures that damage the forests or caves that the reside in will find themselves pursued relentlessly by an implacable foe. Those that show respect for its land, however, may be given a chance to explain themselves before they are viciously gutted.

This exceedingly deadly venom is brewed from the horn of the black unicorn and is reserved exclusively for use by the lords of the Gloaming Court. The secret of its crafting is jealously guarding by the Unseelie poison masters, and any unauthorized creature found in possession of either the poison or its recipe is mercilessly hunted by quicklings, spriggans, and other dark fey.

A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, with the save being made with advantage if the creature is in bright sunlight. On a failure, the target is poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is paralyzed and cannot recover hit points. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. However, on a failure the target's heart stops and it dies immediately.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the unicorn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Carve Glyph (3/Day)
entries: The unicorn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately use it action for 1 hour to place a magical glyph on a living tree or plant. The plant of tree must be Huge or larger. After 1 hour of concentration (as if concentrating on a spell) the unicorn inscribe a {@b Glyph of Gloom}. While the glyph is inscribed, natural light sources can't raise the light level above dim light. Additionally, the radius of dim light is halved for all light produced by spells of 2nd-level or lower, or magic items of uncommon or lesser rarity. Any tree that has a Glyph of Gloom placed on it will wither and die within a year.

trait.name: Frightful Gallop
entries: If the unicorn takes the {@action Dash} action, it can choose to make the sound of its hooves supernaturally terrifying. Each creature that is within 120 feet of the unicorn and can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the unicorn's Frightful Gallop for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the shadow unicorn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shadow unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Empowered Strikes
entries: The shadow unicorn's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow unicorn can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to {@hit 8}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The unicorn makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn or Blighting Touch.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Blighting Touch (3/Day)
entries: The unicorn makes one attack with its horn. On a success, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for 24 hours. While cursed in this way, the target's flesh appears withered, the target cannot recover hit points, and it is vulnerable to necrotic damage. If a non-evil humanoid dies while cursed in this way, a {@creature shadow} rises from the corpse {@dice 1d4} hours later. A {@spell remove curse} spell of similar magic can cure this curse.

legendary.name: Hooves
entries: The unicorn makes one attack with its hooves.

legendary.name: Blink {@recharge 4}
entries: The unicorn vanishes from its current plane of existence and appears in the same location in the Border Ethereal. At the beginning of its next turn the unicorn reappears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the space it vanished from. If no unoccupied space is available within that range, it appears in the nearest unoccupied space (chosen at random if more than one space is equally near).

The first unicorns were creatures of divine beauty and heartbreaking grace, and many continue to trot the path of focused, perfect elegance. However, some unicorns are drawn away from these divine origins, whether by birth or by tragedy. These are the dark unicorns.

A shadow unicorn is born from the regret and bitterness of a unicorn that died in sorrow. They appear to be unicorns made of solid, shifting shadows, and when enraged their horns become wreathed in the same crimson flames that flicker in their hateful eyes. A shadow unicorn may be created from any number of inciting tragedies, such as a unicorn whose forest was burned to the ground, a unicorn whose dearest friend was killed before their very eyes, or a unicorn whose foal perished. If sorrow and bitterness are allowed to grow unchecked in the unicorn's heart, they may waste away into a hateful shadow.

entries.name: Terror in the Dark
entries: A shadow unicorn wants only to spread fear and misery. They can travel without a sound when they wish, slipping in unnoticed among unsuspecting victims and then vanishing without a trace, but when they wish to strike fear into the hearts of their victims they can turn their thunderous hoofbeats into a terrifying refrain. Their horns can even lay a terrible curse of withering on their victims, making shadow unicorns attractive steeds for undead warriors such as wights, wraiths, and even death knights and fiends.

entries.name: Redemption
entries: Though slim, there is a hope for redemption for a shadow unicorn. Should it be reminded of the beauty of life, of the goodness that lives deep within all things, they may be able to let go of their bitterness and fade away peacefully. However, reaching the last spark of hope left in a shadow unicorn's soul is not an easy task, and will require learning about the unicorn.

trait.name: Empowered Strikes
entries: The creekrotter's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the calvary creekrotter must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the calvary creekrotter's stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Body of Pollution
entries: The creekrotter's body is comprised primarily of polluted water and rotten plants. It counts as a plant creature for the purposes of spells such as {@spell blight}. Additionally, spells that purify water and cure disease deal {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage per spell level to the creekrotter.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The creekrotter makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the creekrotter hits a single target with two slam attacks on the same turn, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}).

action.name: Vomit Foulness (Recharge After a Long or Short Rest)
entries: The creekrotter regurgitates polluted water, animal corpses, and dead vegetation in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) poison damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. Additionally, all creatures in the area become slimed with a combination of dead vegetation and rotten material. Until the slime is scraped off with an action, the target's movements are restricted, reducing its speed by half and imposing disadvantage on all Dexterity saving throws, Strength and Dexterity skill checks, and weapon attack rolls.

Composed of mud, excrement, rotting vegetation, dead aquatic animals, and toxic liquids, a calvary creekrotter delivers vengeance upon anything it perceives as a threat to nature. Born from rivers, lakes, and marshes choked with the pollution of humanoid settlements, these heaving masses of foulness dredge themselves up from the filth and detritus of their dying homes to vomit the land's hatred over those who have wronged it.

trait.name: Distraction
entries: A creature within the cinderswarm's space has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and saving throws to maintain concentration on spells.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: A creature that touches the cinderswarm or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. In addition, the cinderswarm can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The cinderswarm sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The cinderswarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.
If the swarm is reduced to between one quarter and half of its maximum hitpoints, its size is Large. If the swarm has one quarter of its maximum hit points or fewer, its size is Medium.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cinderswarm makes a number of attacks with its cinder strike depending on its current size: three if it is Huge, two if it is Large, one if it is Medium.

action.name: Cinder Strike
entries: One creature within the cinderswarm's space must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage on a failure or half as much on a success.

A cinderswarm is a massive, roiling cloud of thousands upon thousands of miniscule fire elementals, each no larger or more powerful than a fleck of ash from a campfire. However, as a group a cinderswarm becomes a terrible threat. Possessed with an unquenchable urge to ignite everything it encounters and able to flow through virtually any gap, a cinderswarm is a force of destruction.

A cinderswarm is born in the wake of a devastating wildfire. Each cinder born of a life lost to the blaze, these raging clouds of fire seek vengeance for the fate of their homes, razing humanoid settlements to the ground in an effort to assuage their formless rage.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: A cinderswarm does not require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The animated teddy is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an {@i antimagic field}. If targeted by {@i dispel magic}, the animated teddy must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Comfort Object
entries: While in contact with the teddy and the teddy is not {@condition incapacitated}, a creature has advantage on all Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the animated teddy remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal teddy bear.

trait.name: Powerful Teddy
entries: The teddy counts as a Medium creature for the purposes of its carrying capacity.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Defender
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the teddy is hit by an attack, the teddy swaps places with that creature and is hit instead.

Animated toys are a unique variant of animated objects. Creating an animated toy can be accomplished with the animate objects spell, but the caster must know the secret of creating that specific variant of the object, which can be learned from a whimsical artificer, a thoughtful uldra wondermaker, or a kindly old befana hag.

An animated teddy is a child's stuffed animal, usually a bear, given life through magic. These constructs are slightly smarter than a typical animated object, possessing just enough intelligence to recognize a specific individual as their master and to provide comfort to that individual when needed. Kindly hags are fond of crafting these constructs to act as the guardians and friends of lonely or abused children, as these toys will gladly lay down their lives to protect the child to which they are bound.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The banbury hobby horse is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an {@i antimagic field}. If targeted by {@i dispel magic}, the hobby horse must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the banbury hobby horse remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a mundane hobby horse.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the banbury hobby horse is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the banbury hobby horse instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: Playtime
entries: The banbury hobby horse can be ridden by a Small creature with a weight not exceeding 150 pounds if it recognizes the creature as its rider. In order to be recognized as a rider, a creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) check over the course of a long rest.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Animated Attack
entries: If a creature that the hobby horse does not recognize as its rider tries to ride it, the broom makes a Dexterity check contested by the creature's Strength check. If the broom wins the contest, it flies out of the creature's grasp.

Animated toys are a unique variant of animated objects. Creating an animated toy can be accomplished with the animate objects spell, but the caster must know the secret of creating that specific variant of the object, which can be learned from a whimsical artificer, a thoughtful uldra wondermaker, or a kindly old befana hag.

A hobby horse is a stick bearing a crafted horse head that children can use to pretend to ride a real horse. A banbury hobby horse takes this one step further. It is granted just enough intelligence to be about as smart as a horse, and it can fly just above the ground.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The regiment of tin soldiers is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an {@i antimagic field}. If targeted by {@i dispel magic}, the regiment of tin soldiers must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the regiment of tin soldiers remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a collection of toy soldiers.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The regiment of tin soldiers can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny toy soldier. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Swords
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the regiment's space. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Arrows
entries: The regiment unleashes a hail of tiny arrows in a 15-foot cone origination from it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking full damage on a failure or half as much damage on a success. If the regiment has full hit points, full damage is 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage, if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer full damage is 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

Animated toys are a unique variant of animated objects. Creating an animated toy can be accomplished with the animate objects spell, but the caster must know the secret of creating that specific variant of the object, which can be learned from a whimsical artificer, a thoughtful uldra wondermaker, or a kindly old befana hag.

Tin soldiers are sculpted soldiers just a few inches high that children can use to enact mock battles. When animated, these toys may be assembled into disciplined regiments that serve the will of whatever creature commands them. They can attack with dozens of tiny swords or pepper enemies with numerous minuscule arrows, making them surprisingly effective.

entries.name: Gunpowder Weapons
entries: In settings where gunpowder exists, tin soldiers might wield muskets with bayonets rather than swords and bows. The statistics of the soldiers remain the same regardless.

monster.name: Asperii
languages: understands Auran and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Windrider
entries: If the asperii is traveling with a tailwind, it adds the speed of the wind to its flying speed. If traveling into a headwind, the asperii suffers no reduction in speed.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Feather Fall
entries: When one or more creatures the the asperii can see within 60 feet of it fall, the asperii chooses up to five of those falling creatures. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round for 1 minute. If the creature lands before the effect ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, and the effect ends for that creature.

Also known as wind steeds, these good hearted, horse-like fey are spirits of the cold north wind and are highly prized as mounts for righteous warriors. However, these incredibly intelligent creatures will not accept just anyone as a partner. Only the good of heart and staunch of spirit will be permitted to mount an asperii. Once it has accepted a rider, though, it remains unflappably loyal to that rider, refusing to bond to any other creature for the rest of its life.

entries.name: Herds in the Clouds
entries: The asperii can fly without effort, and will only descend to the earth to search for food, favoring fish, hawks, mint leaves, and mistletoe over all other foods. They live in small, tightly knit herds of up to a dozen individuals, which will aggressively defend themselves from their hated enemies of hippogriffs and griffons. A strong enough herd may even attack a roc. However, they are typically very gentle, preferring to simply avoid unfamiliar creatures when possible so as not to invite conflict. Only pegasi are able to approach an asperii herd without scaring them away.

entries.name: Greatest Mounts
entries: With their powers of flight and telepathy, asperii are highly sought after as mounts. Though not as fast as pegasi, they can ride the winds. With the winds at their back they can far exceed the swiftness of all other creatures of the air, and they are not even troubled when galloping directly into a storm. Even if their rider falls from their backs, an asperii has the ability to slow their descent to ensure that no harm comes to them from the fall. As such, many paladins seek to learn the secrets of summoning an asperii with {@spell find greater steed}.

entries.name: Asperii Blackhearts
entries: Though asperii are kind and noble by nature, they can be corrupted. The dark influence of an evil winter fey such as the Prince of Frost or a virage can slowly poison the pure heart of an asperii, turning them into twisted, hateful creatures loyal only to their master. These asperii have a lawful evil alignment.

monster.name: Noble Asperii
languages: understands Auran and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Mental Suggestion
entries: The noble asperii can telepathically cast {@spell suggestion} with a range of 90 feet, requiring no components. The noble asperii's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}).

trait.name: Windrider
entries: If the noble asperii is traveling with a tailwind, it adds the speed of the wind to its flying speed (+1 ft to flight speed for each 1 mph of the prevailing wind). If traveling into a headwind, the noble asperii suffers no reduction in speed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The asperii makes two attacks with its hooves.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Feather Fall
entries: When one or more creatures the the noble asperii can see within 60 feet of it fall, the noble asperii chooses up to five of those falling creatures. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round for 1 minute. If the creature lands before the effect ends, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet, and the effect ends for that creature.

Also known as wind steeds, these good hearted, horse-like fey are spirits of the cold north wind and are highly prized as mounts for righteous warriors. However, these incredibly intelligent creatures will not accept just anyone as a partner. Only the good of heart and staunch of spirit will be permitted to mount an asperii. Once it has accepted a rider, though, it remains unflappably loyal to that rider, refusing to bond to any other creature for the rest of its life.

entries.name: Herds in the Clouds
entries: The asperii can fly without effort, and will only descend to the earth to search for food, favoring fish, hawks, mint leaves, and mistletoe over all other foods. They live in small, tightly knit herds of up to a dozen individuals, which will aggressively defend themselves from their hated enemies of hippogriffs and griffons. A strong enough herd may even attack a roc. However, they are typically very gentle, preferring to simply avoid unfamiliar creatures when possible so as not to invite conflict. Only pegasi are able to approach an asperii herd without scaring them away.

entries.name: Greatest Mounts
entries: With their powers of flight and telepathy, asperii are highly sought after as mounts. Though not as fast as pegasi, they can ride the winds. With the winds at their back they can far exceed the swiftness of all other creatures of the air, and they are not even troubled when galloping directly into a storm. Even if their rider falls from their backs, an asperii has the ability to slow their descent to ensure that no harm comes to them from the fall. As such, many paladins seek to learn the secrets of summoning an asperii with {@spell find greater steed}.

A noble asperii is an asperii that has assumed the role of the leader of its herd. These asperii possess beautiful, iridescent coats and have the ability to influence the minds of other beings. Only the truest, most powerful warriors of righteousness are allowed to even approach a noble asperii.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The belsnick has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The belsnick makes three attacks: one with its ram and two with its club.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

The belsnick are close cousins to satyrs that are adapted to cold weather climates. They possess goat heads rather than the faces of humans and are protected by a coat of thick, fleecy fur. Though they still love good food and merriment, belsnick are more reserved than satyrs and rarely go to the hedonistic excesses of their warm weather cousins.

entries.name: Woolen Coat
entries: Belsnick grow thick coats of fleecy fur which keep them warm during the winter. However, these coats are often uncomfortably warm during the summer months. As such, the belsnick have an intricate tradition of shearing their excess fur in early spring and spinning it into yarn to craft blankets, cloaks, and clothes for themselves or for humanoids that they are fond of. Belsnick wool is exceedingly soft and silky, making it highly prized. Many wealthy parties will pay very handsomely for a belsnick sweater or scarf.

entries.name: Variant: Belsnick Bells
entries: A belsnick might carry bells that it can play to create magical effects. Usually, only one belsnick in a group carries such bells. If a belsnick has bells, it gains the following additional action option:

entries.name: Bells
entries: The belsnick plays its bells and chooses one of the following magical effects: a charming melody or a gentle lullaby. Any creature within 60 feet of the belsnick that can hear the bells must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be affected as described below. Other belsnicks and creature that can't be charmed are unaffected.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to these bells for the next 24 hours.

items: {@b Charming Melody.} The creature is charmed by the belsnick for 1 minute. If the belsnick or any of its companions harms the creature, the effect on it ends immediately.
{@b Gentle Lullaby.} The creature falls asleep and is unconscious for 1 minute. The effect ends if the creature takes damage or if someone takes an action to shake the creature awake.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The belsnick hollybough is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The belsnick hollybough has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: When the belsnickhollybough hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can expend a spell slot to cause the attack to magically deal an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage, or 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage if the target is a fiend or undead. If the belsnick hollybough expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

trait.name: Jingle Bells
entries: When the belsnick hollybough moves or makes an attack, it can choose to play a joyful song with the bells attached to its armor and weapons. Creatures not hostile to the belsnick within 60 feet of it that can hear it have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws until the start of the belsnick hollybough's turn.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The belsnick hollybough has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The belsnick hollybough makes three attacks: one with its ram and two with its quarterstaff.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

The belsnick are close cousins to satyrs that are adapted to cold weather climates. They possess goat heads rather than the faces of humans and are protected by a coat of thick, fleecy fur. Though they still love good food and merriment, belsnick are more reserved than satyrs and rarely go to the hedonistic excesses of their warm weather cousins.

entries.name: Woolen Coat
entries: Belsnick grow thick coats of fleecy fur which keep them warm during the winter. However, these coats are often uncomfortably warm during the summer months. As such, the belsnick have an intricate tradition of shearing their excess fur in early spring and spinning it into yarn to craft blankets, cloaks, and clothes for themselves or for humanoids that they are fond of. Belsnick wool is exceedingly soft and silky, making it highly prized. Many wealthy parties will pay very handsomely for a belsnick sweater or scarf.

A belsnick hollybough is a belsnick who, seeing the cruelty of winter, resolved to bring light to the darkest months of the year. These belsnick devote themselves to bringing joy and merriment to those who suffer during the winter, bringing coal and firewood to warm houses and wine and brandy to warm spirits.

entries.name: Boughs of Holly
entries: These belsnick do not only seek merriment, for during winter there are many threats to contend with. A hollybough is a staunch warrior, using martial might and divine magic to combat the evil creatures that would prey on innocents. It carries a sturdy quarterstaff made of holly, and with this it fends of ghosts, monsters, and wicked fey alike.

entries.name: Jingle Bells
entries: A hollybough loves to see others smile, and they have developed their skill in bell playing to such an extent that just the sound of its merry jingling brings joy to those who hear them. A hollybough typically decks itself out in bells, which it straps to its limbs and body or dangles from its antlers. It can play these bells by adopting a humorous, capering walk, shaking them merrily as it goes. Just the sound of these bells is enough to fortify spirits and chase away sorrow and fear.

entries.name: Variant: Belsnick Bells
entries: A belsnick might carry bells that it can play to create magical effects. Usually, only one belsnick in a group carries such bells. If a belsnick has bells, it gains the following additional action option:

entries.name: Bells
entries: The belsnick plays its bells and chooses one of the following magical effects: a charming melody or a gentle lullaby. Any creature within 60 feet of the belsnick that can hear the bells must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be affected as described below. Other belsnicks and creature that can't be charmed are unaffected.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to these bells for the next 24 hours.

items: {@b Charming Melody.} The creature is charmed by the belsnick for 1 minute. If the belsnick or any of its companions harms the creature, the effect on it ends immediately.
{@b Gentle Lullaby.} The creature falls asleep and is unconscious for 1 minute. The effect ends if the creature takes damage or if someone takes an action to shake the creature awake.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The belsnick rutenschlager is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The belsnick rutenschlager has the following warlock spells prepared:

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the belsnick rutenschlager's darkvision.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The belsnick rutenschlager has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The belsnick rutenschlager makes three attacks: one with its ram and two with either its club or its eldritch blast.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Haunting Bells
entries: The belsnick rutenschlager plays a haunting tune on its bells. Each non-fey creature within 60 feet of the belsnick that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the belsnick rutenschlager's Haunting Bells for the next 24 hours.

The belsnick are close cousins to satyrs that are adapted to cold weather climates. They possess goat heads rather than the faces of humans and are protected by a coat of thick, fleecy fur. Though they still love good food and merriment, belsnick are more reserved than satyrs and rarely go to the hedonistic excesses of their warm weather cousins.

entries.name: Woolen Coat
entries: Belsnick grow thick coats of fleecy fur which keep them warm during the winter. However, these coats are often uncomfortably warm during the summer months. As such, the belsnick have an intricate tradition of shearing their excess fur in early spring and spinning it into yarn to craft blankets, cloaks, and clothes for themselves or for humanoids that they are fond of. Belsnick wool is exceedingly soft and silky, making it highly prized. Many wealthy parties will pay very handsomely for a belsnick sweater or scarf.

A rutenschlager is a belsnick who, craving power, turned to infernal patrons to gain magical power. These cruel minded fey wield hellish flames, spreading fear and misery to those that fail to satisfy its desire for material pleasure. Their power is not free, though, and they must perform tasks for their fiendish patrons in order to retain their power. As a mark of their service to Hell, these belsnick grow a long, devilish tail and their eye glow with a dull, ominous red light capable of piercing even magical darkness.

entries.name: Pact Rods
entries: When a rutenschlager forges its deal with its patron, it constructs a bundle of birch branches known as a ruten. This ruten represents the contract for the belsnick's service to their patron, and is able to channel the arcane energy of their pact into both spells and deadly strikes. If its ruten is destroyed, the belsnick loses the ability to cast many of its spells until such time as it can construct a new one.

entries.name: Frightening Bells
entries: All belsnick have musical skill, but the rutenschlager have twisted that music towards evil. They can play their bells in such a way as to fill the minds of those that hear the playing with fear, softening up their victims before they descend on them with deadly spells and vicious devils.

entries.name: Variant: Belsnick Bells
entries: A belsnick might carry bells that it can play to create magical effects. Usually, only one belsnick in a group carries such bells. If a belsnick has bells, it gains the following additional action option:

entries.name: Bells
entries: The belsnick plays its bells and chooses one of the following magical effects: a charming melody or a gentle lullaby. Any creature within 60 feet of the belsnick that can hear the bells must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be affected as described below. Other belsnicks and creature that can't be charmed are unaffected.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to these bells for the next 24 hours.

items: {@b Charming Melody.} The creature is charmed by the belsnick for 1 minute. If the belsnick or any of its companions harms the creature, the effect on it ends immediately.
{@b Gentle Lullaby.} The creature falls asleep and is unconscious for 1 minute. The effect ends if the creature takes damage or if someone takes an action to shake the creature awake.

monster.name: Chilblain
languages: Understands Auran and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Cold Aura
entries: At the start of each of the chilblain's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage. A creature that touches the chilblain or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

trait.name: Frozen Stare
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the chilblain and the two of them can see each other, the chilblain can force the creature to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw if the chilblain isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to freeze and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success or upon taking fire damage, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is frozen solid until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic. Creatures immune to cold damage are immune to this effect.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the chilblain until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the chilblain in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The chilblain can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The chilblain can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chilblain makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its tail.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

When the Prince of Frost abandoned his title as the Sun Prince and retreated into the frozen north, he took with him a number of stonesingers, the insectoid monsters loved by the Unseelie Fey for their magnificent singing and ability to transform their victims into stone. These monsters were twisted by the Pale Prince, who poured his bitterness and cruelty into their veins until their carapaces crusted over with ice and their eyes glowed with their master's sorrowful malice. Even a single glance from one of these scuttling horrors can freeze a mortal solid.

entries.name: Yearning for Music
entries: The stonesingers that the Prince of Frost stole from the Gloaming Court are lovers of music, singing the most hauntingly beautiful songs from the grotesque, lamprey-like mouths at the tips of their tails. However, the Prince of Frost cannot abide music, and when he twisted the stonesingers into his servants he froze their mouths into a solid block of ice. However, he could not extinguish the craving for music in their souls. Even now, a beautiful song can be used to tame these strange monsters for a time, causing them to crowd around the source of the music in a desperate attempt to hear more.

monster.name: Clubthorn
languages: understands Druidic and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the clubthorn remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal holly tree.

trait.name: Root Tendrils
entries: The clubthorn can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage, resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the clubthorn, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn.

trait.name: Sticky Sap
entries: When the clubthorn is hit with a weapon that deals slashing or piercing damage, the sap under its bark adheres to the weapon. A successful {@dc 15} Strength check is needed to remove the weapon. If the attack dealt acid or fire damage as part of the attack, the weapon does not become adhered. Vinegar or an effect that deals fire or acid damage applied to the adhered weapon frees the weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clubthorn makes four attacks with its root tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one slam attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Root Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Reel
entries: The clubthorn pulls each creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

A clubthorn is a vicious, predatory relative of the holly tree. With glossy green leaves as hard as boiled leather and bright red berries, it is virtually indistinguishable from its passive cousin. It uses this natural disguise to capture unsuspecting victims with the root-like tendrils growing at the base of its trunk. These victims are reeled into range of the clubthorn's savage slams, which both bludgeon its victims and strip away their flesh. When its prey is subdued, the clubthorn then plants its sharp, stubby roots into the victim's flesh, draining it of its fluids until its just a withered husk. In this way, the clubthorn is able to thrive even during the winter.

entries.name: Useful but Dangerous
entries: A clubthorn typically only moves either to escape fire or to find a new hunting ground after it feeds to prevent its previous kills from scaring off new prey. They have few natural enemies, thanks not only to its razor sharp leaves but also to their aggressively sticky sap, which is capable of gluing the jaws or mandibles of hopeful herbivores shut. Only acid or fire is able to overcome this adhesive defense. As a result, young black dragons are among the only creatures in the natural world capable of safely eating these deadly plants. Beyond black dragons, though, the only other creatures with an interest in clubthorns are the druids, wizards, and alchemists who can utilize the magical properties of their berries in a variety of ways.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing a tireganierk's lair is enriched by the fey's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Plant life is hardier within 3 miles of the tireganierk's lair. All plant life benefits from the effects of the plant growth spell as if with the 8 hour casting time version. All plant life is better able to resist the cold, and any plant monsters native to the area or conjured within the area has resistance to cold damage.
Creatures friendly to the tireganierk have advantage on saving throws to resist {@condition exhaustion}.

The first time a humanoid harms animal or plant life while within 3 miles of the tireganierk's lair, it must perform a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the creature's sense of direction becomes useless for 1 week. During that time, all Survival checks that it makes to prevent becoming lost automatically fail, and all Survival checks to forage for food and track have disadvantage. The creature can perform the saving throw again after each long rest, ending the effects early on a success.

entries: If the tireganierk dies, the enriched soil remains for several seasons. All other effects fade over {@dice 2d10} days.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eladrin's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eladrin paletouched hunter is a 17th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The eladrin paletouched hunter has the following ranger spells prepared:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the eladrin paletouched hunter fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The eladrin paletouched hunter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Terrifying Presence
